gpt-4o-mini_translate: Present a case for raising the wage level in female-dominated professions in the public sector, and consider a gender equality fund for these, which would be in addition to regular collective bargaining agreements and distributed after negotiations between the parties.

Investigate the consequences of the hospitals not receiving the 75 million that the government itself states it cost when the hospitals took responsibility for the assault reception. The results of the investigation are to be presented to the Storting no later than together with the proposal for the state budget for 2020.

Assume that good and voluntary processes should be the basis for changes in the county structure. Mergers of counties should be based on voluntariness. In cases where counties do not wish to merge, the mergers will not be carried out.

Present a message about taxes where the effects on, among other things, distribution, employment, value creation, and jobs across the country are analyzed, and where the message aims to lay the foundation for a better and more predictable tax policy.

Establish a grant scheme that covers the costs associated with the disposal of waste following voluntary cleanup actions. The new scheme must be viewed in conjunction with the existing scheme that has already been implemented for measures against marine littering and the spread of microplastics.
Present a parliamentary report on a stronger focus on bioenergy.

Initiate a dialogue with the Church of Norway, the Employers' Organization for Church Activities, KS, relevant voluntary heritage organizations, and other stakeholders on how a strengthened strategy for the maintenance of culturally and historically significant churches can be developed.

Present a proposal for changes to the regulations regarding the obligation to cover costs for archaeological investigations in connection with expansions and new constructions of operational buildings on ordinary farms, so that the main rule becomes that the state, through a grant scheme, covers the costs of such investigations.
Initiate the project for the procurement of new tanks for the mechanized maneuver units in the Army during 2018.
Ensure that all imported feed, including from EU countries, is inspected and approved by the Food Safety Authority before further distribution.

Investigate whether it is possible to use actual yields as a basis for calculating crop damage compensation in forage production, to ensure that producers with yields higher than the normal yield in the municipality receive adequate compensation in the event of loss.
Review the crop damage compensation scheme to prevent the agricultural sector from being undermined due to economic losses in the face of greater climate changes in the years to come.

Establish a working group with representation from the agricultural unions that can develop a model for a climate fund for agriculture, and as soon as possible report back to the Parliament with such a proposal.
Implement an extraordinary monitoring program to detect any disease outbreaks as early as possible due to the extraordinary import of feed.
Propose a legislative amendment that grants children in grades 1-4 and grades 1-7 for children with special needs a legal right to a place in the after-school care program.
Investigate the introduction of free core hours in the after-school program for low-income families.
Clarify to the municipalities that defaulted parental payments can only be sanctioned through ordinary forms of debt collection, and not by depriving a child of a place in the after-school program.
Consider relevant measures to prevent students from being excluded from after-school care (SFO) due to their parents' financial situation.
Introduce additional regulations for tanning beds to limit the occurrence of melanoma, including investigating a ban on advertising.
Reassess the regulatory and enforcement regime for tanning salons to limit the occurrence of melanoma, including exploring a ban on advertising.
Ensure sufficient capacity within the pathology field to be prepared for the anticipated increase in both melanoma and other cancers in the coming years.
Facilitate a more comprehensive and structured effort on information, prevention, and early detection of skin cancer.

Ensure that the website hvakostertannlegen.no becomes a real tool for customers by having all dentists register their prices there in a way that makes them comparable. The government is also asked to consider measures against dentists who choose not to use this site, while simultaneously running a practice where they receive reimbursements for dental treatments from the public sector.

Assess the need for an extension of rights under the National Insurance Act for individuals with certain cancer diagnoses that affect oral health, as well as cancer survivors with aftereffects that impact dental health.

Promote measures to reduce antibiotic resistance in the Norwegian dental health service and measures to prevent an increase in dental treatment in countries with a high risk of spreading resistant bacteria.
Evaluate the competence centers for dental health, with the premise that the competence centers should contribute to a decentralization and further development of regional expertise in dental health.

Ensure that the Prioritization Committee for municipal health and care services and dental health also provides suggestions on which reimbursement schemes should be prioritized, and the structure of these, if the reimbursement schemes are to be expanded with the aim of reaching more vulnerable groups.

Investigate a price cap for dental treatments that are fully or partially reimbursed by the public sector, where the reimbursement rates must be perceived as predictable for both patients and dental health professionals.
Investigate and return to the Storting with a proposal for an expansion of the public dental health service, where more groups are included in the public dental health service.

Come back to the Parliament with a separate case regarding the strengthening of Norwegian dental health, with the aim of reducing social inequality in dental health by helping those who need it the most. The Parliament requests that the case includes: a. proposals on how to strengthen preventive work for good public dental health b. a review of the reimbursement schemes in the dental health field c. proposals that will better assist those who currently do not have the financial means to undergo necessary dental treatment d. proposals for improvement and simplification of the reimbursement schemes through the National Insurance for specific diagnoses.

Come back to the Parliament with the proposals necessary to ensure that experiential competence and employees' salary and working conditions are secured when outsourcing all ambulance services, either through requirements for business transfer or equivalent obligations.
Investigate public/non-profit operation of all ambulance services and report back to the Parliament in an appropriate manner.
Ensure that health enterprises do not centralize or close down ambulance services.
Present a action plan for better ambulance services in Norway.
Ensure a maritime and medically sound ambulance boat tender for Lopphavet that also includes requirements for business transfer.

Ensure that the requirements for common emergency medical plans for municipalities and health enterprises, as well as regular training with other emergency services, are established in a future revised emergency medical regulation.
Evaluate the function, development, and financing of the emergency assistance scheme.
Regulate requirements for response time and base the national response times of 8, 12, and 25 minutes on the proposal from the Emergency Committee.

Ensure a maritime and medically sound ambulance boat tender in Lopphavet, where current experience and expertise are maintained, either through negotiations with providers, through a possible new tender round with requirements for business transfer in accordance with the provisions of the Working Environment Act, or in another suitable manner.

Ensure that the investigation into public/non-profit operation of the air ambulance service, cf. decision 861 (Innst. 362 S (2017-2018)), adopted by a unanimous parliament, is completed no later than the end of the current parliamentary term, so that the Parliament can consider this before any new tender process is initiated or the existing contract is extended.
Present a parliamentary report on pre-hospital services and the entire emergency medical chain based on NOU 2015:17 First and Foremost.
Ensure that the 16 bed spaces in the rehabilitation department 2 East in Eigersund are maintained.

To strengthen the rehabilitation services for patients with COPD in both municipalities and health enterprises, and to ensure that health enterprises do not reduce their services before a corresponding offer has been established in the municipalities.
Correct the geographical and regional differences in patients' access to specialized rehabilitation.

Ensure that the municipalities in the region have the opportunity to build the necessary competence and capacity to take over the responsibility for the relevant patient group if the decision to close the rehabilitation department 2 East in Eigersund is upheld.
Ensure that the water management plans remain regional plans according to the Planning and Building Act, and that the planning processes follow the provisions of the Planning and Building Act.
Regulatory requirements for occupational therapy and physiotherapy competence in nursing homes.

Initiate a mapping of the human rights situation in Norwegian nursing homes and home care services, where residents and users themselves, as well as their relatives, are also sources. The government is requested to report to the Storting in an appropriate manner.

Investigate a change in the Housing Bank's grant scheme for round-the-clock care places in nursing homes and care homes, so that the grant schemes can also include sheltered housing without round-the-clock care.

Take the initiative with the parties in the labor market to establish a collaboration for the creation of a pool of substitute teachers with permanent employees in the municipalities, possibly as a collaboration between neighboring municipalities.

Ensure that the planned grant scheme for the renovation, establishment, or re-establishment of local kitchens in nursing homes is investigated and presented during the first half of 2019, and that funds for the scheme are allocated in the proposal for the revised national budget.
Investigate a separate grant scheme for positions that can ensure increased interdisciplinary competence and more volunteer work in Norwegian nursing homes and home care services.
Promote a proposal to include "loneliness" in the Public Health Act § 7.
Stimulate the establishment of low-threshold mental health services for the elderly in several municipalities.
Facilitate for municipalities and volunteer organizations to strengthen their work and initiatives so that the elderly and those living alone can have someone to share meals with.
Present a comprehensive national strategy for good diet and healthy nutrition for the elderly receiving services in nursing homes and home care, with proposals for specific, targeted measures.
Consider specific measures to strengthen the nutritional expertise and the systematic nutritional work in the health and care services, and report back to the Parliament in an appropriate manner.
Promote your own case to the Storting regarding palliative care and follow-up of NOU 2017:16 On Life and Death – Palliative Care for the Seriously Ill and Dying.
Promote a proposal to amend the alcohol law in order to reduce the maximum serving time from 3:00 AM to 2:00 AM.
Propose a change in the law that ensures municipal sales and serving fees are set to a minimum of one percent of alcohol sales.

Investigate whether there are groups that need an expanded information program related to the harmful effects of alcohol and other substances during pregnancy, and whether the national professional guidelines for maternity care are being adequately followed or need reinforcement.
Come back to the Parliament with proposals for measures that limit consumption-driven product information about alcohol.

Ensure that all pregnant women receive good information about the harm that alcohol consumption during pregnancy can cause to the child, including making sure that absolutely all pregnant women are informed about this during their prenatal check-ups.
Establish a public committee to assess the significant societal costs of alcohol for communities, the workforce, and individuals and their families.
Initiate a collaboration with sports organizations to strengthen efforts to make sports an alcohol-free zone.

Invite the parties in the labor market to strengthen cooperation to increase awareness of attitudes towards alcohol in the workplace, to promote the value of alcohol-free environments, and to emphasize the need for choice and reduced alcohol pressure in work contexts.
Promote a proposal to the Parliament to introduce requirements for labeling alcoholic beverages.
Introduce stronger measures against alcohol smuggling to Norway through better control mechanisms, including sufficient operational resources for enforcement work.
Facilitate treatment options for entire families with alcohol problems.
To ensure that pregnant women with substance dependence receive closer follow-up, and to ensure that there are enough places to meet the need for treatment and support for the women and children.
Introduce a labeling system for alcoholic beverages with health warnings about alcohol consumption during pregnancy and in connection with driving.
Reverse the expansion that was made to the duty-free scheme in 2014 from January 1, 2020.

Consider a reversal of the latest change to the tax-free quota based on an evaluation of how the quota affects Vinmonopolet's sales and its position as one of the most important alcohol policy instruments.
Promote a national alcohol strategy for the Parliament, which outlines how the alcohol policy goals of reducing alcohol consumption will be achieved.
Not to make changes to the point system, but to ensure that the evaluation is expedited, if possible.
Assume that the maximum number of points before revocation of the license should be eight, not twelve.
Present a plan for the escalation of public and non-profit ownership and operation to ensure that kindergartens are run by public or non-profit entities.
Introduce or promote necessary proposals to implement a requirement that when a kindergarten is sold, the new owner must reapply for funding.

Introduce a reporting obligation and pre-emption right for the municipality in the sale of kindergartens and promote proposals for any necessary legal amendments to establish such rights and obligations.
Promote the proposals necessary to adjust the pension subsidy for private kindergartens so that it corresponds to the actual pension costs incurred by the kindergartens.
Change the regulations so that the entire pension subsidy received by private kindergartens is used in accordance with its purpose and benefits the employees in the kindergarten.
Ensure that municipalities have the ability to impose the same requirements on private and public kindergartens.

Present a case for the introduction of a reporting obligation and pre-emption right for the municipality in the sale of kindergartens, including an assessment in relation to the provisions of the EEA Agreement, and propose any necessary legislative changes.
Review the financing system for private and municipal kindergartens with the aim of supporting small and non-profit kindergartens and a diverse kindergarten sector.

Introduce a complaint option for decisions regarding compensation for psychological stress injuries resulting from participation in international operations after January 1, 2010, cf. the Defense Act § 55. Those who have served after January 1, 2010, shall be given the same complaint option as those who served before January 1, 2010, cf. the regulation on the complaints board for claims for compensation and ex gratia compensation for psychological stress injuries resulting from participation in international operations, and the complaints will be handled by a special board appointed by the Ministry of Defense. The government is requested to propose to the Storting the necessary legal and regulatory changes for such a complaint system to come into effect as soon as possible.

Propose the necessary legal and regulatory changes to introduce an appeal option for decisions regarding compensation for psychological stress injuries resulting from service in international operations after January 1, 2010.

Establish a complaint system for veterans who have participated in international operations after 2010 and have incurred psychological injuries during these operations. Veteran organizations will be involved in the development of the structure of the complaint system. The establishment of such a complaint system is expected to be included in the mandate of the externally led working group set up by the Ministry of Defence.
Establish a defense commission to invite a broad public debate on changes in the security political landscape, Norway's role, and defense policy changes as a consequence of this.

Take the initiative to renegotiate the Urban Environment Package for Nord-Jæren, with the aim of increasing the focus on public transport, cycling, and walking, including ensuring that the planned bus route is made convertible to a light rail system.
Investigate alternative financing arrangements in the event of cost increases for national roads and bicycle highways in urban packages, also in cases where not all costs are covered by tolls.
Ensure that the state covers 70% of the investment costs for the "Bus Road" in the Urban Environment Package for North-Jæren.
Clarify which other processes related to the Urban Environment Package for Nord-Jæren may require consideration in the Storting.

Initiate the renegotiation of the Urban Environment Package for Nord-Jæren and request that the renegotiation be completed by the end of 2018/2019. The renegotiations should explore a new model for the structure of the rush hour fee that will be less burdensome for the population. The consequences of the rush hour fee for residents and businesses must be investigated more thoroughly, and appropriate mitigating measures must be established.
Take the initiative to test new technology/road pricing in the Nord-Jæren area.

Include a pilot project for the use of trains with fuel cells powered by emission-free hydrogen on at least one of the non-electrified railway lines in Norway – with the aim of operating on one of the lines by January 1, 2020.
Consider starting a trial with hydrogen trains on a smaller scale to test whether the technology can be scaled up and used on the long routes that currently rely on diesel propulsion.

Ensure that new, emission-free, and autonomous ferries are considered as an independent option when planning the Ferry-free E39, alongside tunnels and bridges. Relevant factors for choosing a solution for the future E39 should include environmental considerations, cost, capacity, flexibility, and socio-economic benefits.
Ensure that municipalities exclude child benefits from the calculation of social assistance, and allocate funds for compensation for this in the revised national budget for 2019.

Propose to increase the shipbuilding loan guarantee scheme for ships from shipyards in Norway by 2 billion kroner. It is assumed that the loan guarantees will only be used for the construction of ships with zero or low-emission technology.
Design a model for a tax on salmon lice in the aquaculture industry that provides an estimated revenue effect of 900 million kroner.
Increase the maximum deduction in the tax incentive scheme for startup companies to 650,000 kroner per year.
Establish a national support scheme for the purchase of electric bicycles.
Incorporate into Enova's mandate a goal for full electrification of today's fish farms by 2023.

Present a plan for a gradual phasing out of current oil activities. The pace of the phase-out must be coordinated with the goal of achieving the climate agreement by 2020 and over a 40% reduction in total Norwegian emissions by 2030.
Establish a guarantee fund for renewable investments based on the existing developing country scheme in GIEK. A guarantee framework of 2 billion kroner is allocated in 2019.
Ensure that the Financial Supervisory Authority conducts a stress test of climate risk in Norwegian financial institutions.
Require all county municipalities to submit a climate budget for the budgets for 2020.

Promote a proposal for a change in the law that is necessary to ensure that child benefits are excluded when calculating social assistance, and, in connection with the revised budget for 2019, propose to cover these costs through distribution to all municipalities via the municipal scheme.

Adapt the negotiation mandate related to the negotiations for a CO2 fund for the freight transport sector to include a fund in line with the needs of the business community and based on the model of the NOx fund, so that the negotiations can be completed and the fund established and operational by 2019 in accordance with the previous decisions of the Parliament.

Ensure that the Storting is presented with the funding needs related to the establishment and administration of a CO2 fund for the freight transport sector in connection with the revised national budget for 2019.
Investigate changes to the Value Added Tax Act that ensure healthcare professionals must include value added tax if they provide alternative treatment.

Investigate whether any of the members in the organizations currently registered in the register for alternative practitioners can be considered to provide health care, and return to the Parliament with a legislative proposal that allows them to be exempt from the Value Added Tax Act.

Investigate a fee that effectively excludes biofuels with a high deforestation risk (such as palm oil), and present a proposal in connection with the revised national budget in 2019, with an implementation date of July 1, 2019.
The arrangement with neutral value-added tax in healthcare enterprises is being discontinued.
Evaluate the ABE reform and report back to the Parliament in an appropriate manner.
Facilitate the free and easy disposal of marine waste in harbors through the "Fishing for Litter" scheme.
Investigate whether the municipal pension funds should be subject to taxation, and present the case to the Parliament in an appropriate manner.
Show how Norway's emission reductions to achieve at least a 40% reduction in the non-ETS sector by 2030 will take place in Norway.

Consider the establishment of a professional broadcasting orchestra in connection with NRK, which, modeled after the Broadcasting Orchestra, should have institutional prerequisites to conduct stable artistic activities at a high level.

Promote a proposal to remove the tax exemption for goods shipments from abroad of lower value (the 350-kroner limit) from January 1, 2020. In the design of the regulations, one must take into account the EU's adopted scheme with a tax-free limit, which is to be implemented from 2021.

Design a comprehensive proposal for measures and taxes in the biofuel policy to exclude biofuels with a high deforestation risk, both within and outside the blending mandate. These framework conditions are to be presented in connection with the state budget for 2020 and implemented from January 1, 2020.

Develop and implement a comprehensive plan to ensure oversight and coordinated follow-up from the individual ministries regarding the recommendations from international monitoring bodies to Norway on human rights.

Develop a new overarching, cross-sectoral, as well as economically and temporally binding action plan against violence in close relationships. The action plan must reflect the special needs of vulnerable groups.

Review the recommendations in the annual report for 2017 from Norway's National Institution for Human Rights and return to the Parliament in an appropriate manner regarding how the recommendations have been followed up.

Ensure that the courts are organized and funded in a way that meets the requirements of citizens under the Constitution and the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) to have their cases resolved by the courts within a reasonable time.

Return to the Storting with a comprehensive review of public compensation schemes, which particularly examines which groups are not covered by the schemes, and assess how these should be included or encompassed by other arrangements.

Ensure that there is equal access to compensation for failures of the public sector towards a person who was a child when the failure occurred, regardless of where the person lives in the country, and if necessary, establish a national compensation scheme or a national framework for municipal schemes.

Return to the Parliament with a proposal to coordinate the regulations for compensation with the rules for statute of limitations in the Penal Code, so that claims for compensation do not expire before any potential prosecution.
Ensure that the Storting's compensation scheme is better known and better informed about as a compensation scheme.
Return to the Storting with a review of the various municipal and county compensation and restitution schemes to gain an overview of potentially problematic discriminatory treatment.
Take the initiative with KS to develop a best practice recommendation for voluntary municipal and county compensation schemes.

Return to the Storting with a comprehensive review of public compensation schemes, which specifically examines which groups are not covered by the schemes and assesses whether they should be included.

Facilitate access to affordable legal aid and first-line legal assistance locally, for example through the establishment of local legal centers that can also offer multiple legal services under one roof.
Require the courts to actively determine, in each individual case, whether it has been "reasonable to incur the costs" when determining the legal costs.
Return to the Storting with measures to follow up on this in order to make the system better, more efficient, and more targeted.

Present a proposal for a new legal aid model that aligns with the assessments in Document 8:152 S (2017–2018), and that ensures better legal aid for more people by, among other things, expanding the scope of application, introducing graded co-payments, and raising the income threshold.
Propose different models for annual discussions or negotiations between the state and the Norwegian Bar Association regarding the determination of the public fee rate.

Facilitate the strengthening of the expertise of the conciliation boards and conflict resolution boards, and enhance arrangements that contribute to increased use of mediation and conflict resolution outside of the courts.
Implement concrete measures to reduce legal costs, so that the risk of high legal expenses for ordinary people is minimized, including facilitating a more judge-led process.

Promote a case to the Parliament to raise the limit for small claims procedures and link the limit to the basic amount in the National Insurance Scheme, so that more cases can be processed as small claims.

"Return to the Parliament in an appropriate manner with a comprehensive presentation of how the instruments in Norwegian development and aid policy should be used to strengthen the partner countries' own capacity and ability to facilitate lasting, inclusive, sustainable growth and equitable distribution."
Ensure that the budget share for the least developed countries does not decrease and that efforts are increased to assist countries facing the greatest development challenges in sub-Saharan Africa.
Set demands on all partner countries for progress in the work for transparency, freedom of the press, freedom of expression, freedom of religion, and freedom of association.
Contribute to enabling elite athletes to pursue education by developing more tailored study programs.
Ensure that educational institutions (universities, colleges, and vocational schools) develop more and tailored study programs.

Contribute to ensuring that elite athletes and other groups with special needs for customized study paths have the opportunity for tailored study plans, and that better arrangements are made for part-time students. The government is encouraged in this context to investigate a change in the requirement of 50% study load to receive educational support from the Norwegian State Educational Loan Fund.

To allow elite athletes and others with special reasons to apply for educational support beyond eight years. This must be specifically justified and applied for at the Norwegian State Educational Loan Fund.

Propose that the Boundary Act § 6 be amended to introduce a provision stating that matters concerning boundary adjustments shall be submitted to the Parliament for decision when there is disagreement between the affected municipalities.
Promote the case for the repeal of the forced merger of Telemark and Vestfold counties.
Promote the case for the repeal of the forced merger of Oppland and Hedmark counties.
Promote the case for the repeal of the forced merger of Hordaland and Sogn og Fjordane counties.
Investigate the possibility of dividing Akershus into two and forming two counties on either side of the Oslofjord, and propose this if the counties of Akershus, Østfold, and Buskerud support it.
Promote the case for the repeal of the merger of Troms and Finnmark counties.
Promote the case for the repeal of the merger of Østfold, Akershus, and Buskerud counties.

Facilitate the county councils in Hedmark, Oppland, Sogn og Fjordane, Hordaland, Vestfold, and Telemark to make decisions on whether they wish to repeal the approved county mergers. In cases where one or both county councils decide that they want the approved county mergers to be repealed, the government is requested to present a case to the Storting regarding the repeal of these county mergers.
Come back with a report on the impact of digitalization on reading skills, reading experiences, language development, and language experience.
Come back with a review of how children's and young adult literature and the professional environments related to it can be strengthened.
Come back with a case about the future dissemination of children's and youth literature.

Ensure that the Norwegian Cultural Heritage Fund establishes a dedicated program for climate measures in heritage buildings from before 1950, and request that the government, in the revised budget for 2019, returns to the Storting with a proposal for funding for the project.
Initiate a government preservation program for medieval stone churches aimed at restoring all Norwegian medieval churches by 2030, the 1000th anniversary of the Battle of Stiklestad.
Initiate a government conservation program for the protected wooden churches built before 1650 that are not included in the stave church program.
Initiate a government conservation program for historically significant churches built between 1650 and 1850.
Create a plan for how all counties/regions can have their own building preservation center under the auspices of local museums and/or volunteer cultural heritage organizations.
To come back with a proposal for a scaling-up plan for the Norwegian Cultural Heritage Fund, so that the fund will have 300 million kroner available for distribution annually in the long term.
To transform the incentive scheme for international film and TV productions into a rule-based system and place it under the Ministry of Trade and Fisheries.
Present an overview of how the changes in the cash support scheme have affected mothers' and fathers' labor participation during the period from August 1, 2018, to April 30, 2019.
Continue the reporting obligation for food chains, so that product information suitable for digital solutions is available.
Consider reintroducing the Collection Register/Collection Control as a permanent measure under chapter 315 item 78 Various Permanent Measures.
To make the arrangement for value-added tax compensation for the construction of sports facilities rule-based.
Conduct an external evaluation of the gift enhancement scheme and report back to the Parliament in an appropriate manner.
Propose to increase the size of the private copying compensation so that it aligns with the scope of the scheme.
Promote a proposal to establish a legal right to 100% VAT compensation or a 0% VAT rate for voluntary organizations, which should come into effect by the end of the parliamentary term 2017–2021.
Develop a scaling plan for value-added tax compensation for voluntary organizations that achieves the goal of 100% compensation by the end of the parliamentary period 2017–2021.
Ensure the right to full VAT compensation for all expenses related to new construction, maintenance, and rehabilitation of organization-owned buildings and facilities used in voluntary activities.

Come back to the Parliament with a proposal for a designated increase in funding for municipal library operations over five years before the funding is included in the block grants to the municipalities. The increase should ensure that libraries have greater financial resources to provide what is required by the Public Library Act, and that they can maintain high activity levels and update themselves in response to the needs of the population.

Come back to the Storting with a proposal for the establishment of a common national digital media budget for the purchase of access to digital resources, which will be made available at the country's public libraries, school libraries, and research and university libraries.
Ensure that proximity to the library is maintained when municipalities merge.

Increase the funding for and develop a plan for competence-raising measures for library staff, so that more libraries than today can offer active dissemination in literature, music, and film, as well as assist users with knowledge acquisition and search strategies in an increasingly complex information jungle.

Come back to the Parliament with a separate case regarding school libraries, including an investigation into a possible law on school libraries and a proposal to require municipalities to have a plan for school libraries.

Design a national library strategy that addresses task distribution and collaboration across administrative levels. The strategy should clarify the National Library's national responsibilities and propose a strengthening of the regional level. It should also examine collaboration between public libraries and school libraries and facilitate the further development of combined libraries. Additionally, it should consider how national reading initiatives can play a role in collaboration with libraries.

Ensure the continuation of a national initiative for the establishment of new library facilities, as well as the adaptation or expansion of existing library spaces and mobile library services, and continue to facilitate more open libraries throughout the country. This should contribute to making libraries more accessible, with locations where residents frequent, preferably in a multi-use concept alongside other cultural offerings.
Promote legislation that ensures the qualification program has the same duration as the work assessment allowance.

Monitor the development in the number of participants in the qualification program closely, including whether there are significant differences in the offerings from municipality to municipality, and if necessary, return to the Parliament with a proposal to repeal § 29 third paragraph of the Act on Social Services in the Labor and Welfare Administration.
Consider facilitating an opportunity to participate in a part-time qualification program.

Investigate a government scheme that ensures financial security for those who have not accrued rights in the care benefit scheme. The government must return to the Storting with a proposal for such a scheme as soon as possible.

Ensure that the care allowance scheme is well known in the municipal and state support system, at all hospitals/health institutions, health stations, and among general practitioners, to ensure that written and verbal information about the scheme is provided proactively to all who need it.

Promote necessary proposals for amendments to the regulations governing care allowances to ensure improvements in the grading rules of the care allowance scheme. The amendments should ensure financial security for families by stipulating that care allowances should not be graded when the recipient cannot work due to circumstances related to the child's condition. This should apply when the child requires nighttime support due to their condition, which leads to the parents needing sleep and rest while the child is in a care arrangement. This should also apply when there is a need to be on standby while the child is under supervision and when the child's condition is so severe that work is not possible despite the child being supervised.

Promote a proposal to make an exception to the National Insurance Act § 9-11 second paragraph first sentence when the person who has custody of the child is unable to work while the child is being cared for by others because he or she has been caring for and attending to the child at night and thus needs rest, or it is necessary to be on standby.
Ensure that all unallocated funds under the Research Council's schemes in 2019 are redirected from petroleum to other industries.
Ensure that all unallocated funds under Innovation Norway's schemes in 2019 are redirected from petroleum to other industries.
Set guidelines for the export credit scheme, so that support for projects in renewable energy and other industries is prioritized over support for oil and gas projects.
Consider whether it is possible to introduce incentives through the grant schemes to better ensure the consideration of good animal welfare.
Update the national land protection goal to a maximum of 3,000 acres of cultivated land being developed annually.

Make a new assessment of the basis for the decision to discontinue coal mining in Svalbard and present the matter to the Storting for a decision in connection with the revised national budget for 2019.
Promote a proposal to the Parliament to introduce the possibility of protecting cultivated land.
Investigate and present a proposal to the Storting that requires municipalities to obtain permission from the County Governor to rezone cultivated and arable land for purposes other than agriculture.
Stop the work on a third runway at Oslo Airport Gardermoen.
Stop the land consolidation sale of Statskog.
Investigate and present a new and more aggressive land conservation goal effective from 2020.
Investigate changes that facilitate the supply of rental cars during peak season to meet the ever-growing demand.

Develop an industrial strategy aimed at transforming hazardous waste into industrial added value. The strategy must demonstrate how the state, in collaboration with Norwegian industrial companies and waste actors, can reduce the need for landfilling hazardous waste. The main objective of the strategy should be to ensure that as much as possible of the resources from hazardous waste is converted into resources, thereby gaining added value, either in the form of increased market value or as raw materials for industrial processes.

Follow up the Center for Ocean and Arctic in Tromsø with proposals for appropriations and resources that are in line with the mandate and expectations for the center, and request the government to return with proposals regarding this in connection with the revised national budget for 2019.

Consider future funding for the geoparks, in light of the responsibilities they have as a result of their UNESCO status, and promote proposals to the Parliament in connection with the revised national budget for 2019.

Present the upcoming parliamentary report on preventive maritime safety well ahead of summer 2019, which includes a plan for a national campaign with awareness-raising measures to prevent accidents at sea, mobilizing volunteers along the entire coast.

Establish a public committee to assess the consequences of the introduction and use of new genetic technology methods in relation to food production. The committee must be broadly composed to ensure that as many perspectives as possible are highlighted, existing knowledge is discussed, and the need for new knowledge is mapped out.

Await any implementation of coercive measures in the case regarding reindeer population reduction (Supreme Court ruling of December 21, 2017 (HR-2017-2428-A)) until the UN Human Rights Committee has addressed the matter.

Establish a joint committee to review various aspects of, and possibly propose changes to, the framework conditions for the horse industry. Such a matter must be presented to the Parliament during 2019.
Investigate and present a proposal to ban option agreements on agricultural land in LNF areas.
Investigate a general application and notification obligation in the Agricultural Act to regulate the agricultural sector's own development of cultivated and cultivable land.

Take the initiative to conduct an independent review of the procurement process that resulted in the awarding of Traffic Package 1: South to Go-Ahead Norway AS. The review should investigate whether all regulations regarding public procurement were followed.
Ensure that quality is weighted higher than price in all upcoming tender packages for the railway, including Traffic Package 2: North.
Suspend all tender processes for railway lines, pending the review of Traffic Package 1: South and the changed conditions for Traffic Package 2: North.
Explain how the intention of request resolution no. 264 from the session 2017-2018 is being followed up.

Ensure progress in the planning of a new bridge over the Glomma River on national road 22 in Fet, Akershus, so that the new bridge can be completed according to the timeline developed by the Norwegian Public Roads Administration.

Implement measures to improve the competitive situation for freight transport by rail as quickly as possible, and that the Parliament is informed about the measures no later than in the Revised National Budget for 2019.
Present a timeline for when the double track will be fully developed to Fredrikstad, Hamar, Tønsberg, Hønefoss, Halden, Lillehammer, and Skien.

Clarify whether the Norwegian Public Roads Administration or Nye Veier is responsible for planning the E16 through Nes and Sør-Odal in Akershus and Hedmark, and that the Parliament is informed of the decision no later than in the Revised National Budget for 2019.

Present a plan for the expansion of the E6 in Helgeland, which also includes the sections in Grane municipality, in accordance with previous parliamentary decisions, and that the plan is presented to the Parliament no later than in the Revised National Budget for 2019.

Tighten the zero growth target and establish a goal to significantly reduce total passenger car traffic in the cities of Oslo, Bergen, and Trondheim. The government will engage in dialogue with the cities to find an ambitious and realistic target.

Present a case for the establishment of a state-owned company "Nye Baner," which will be responsible for the investigation, planning, and construction of high-speed trains between the major cities in Norway and to Stockholm and Copenhagen.

Continue the planning of the Ringeriksbanen as a pure railway project, and postpone any construction of a road along the same route. The funds saved in 2019 by halting the planning of the road will be transferred to other railway purposes.
Ensure that the E16 Filefjell project is expanded to also include the stretch from Turtnes to Øye in Vang municipality.

Ensure that the transfer of the purchase of domestic flight routes (FOT routes) is postponed until the government's aviation committee has submitted its recommendation and the matter has been presented to the Parliament for consideration.
Stop planned increases in track fees for freight transport by rail.
Ensure the necessary funds so that the electrification of the Trønderbanen and Meråkerbanen can commence in 2019.

Come back with a separate case regarding the handling of the submarine U-864 off Fedje, where it is also being considered to remove as much of the mercury cargo on board as possible before the area is covered.

Implement adjustments to the grant scheme for the transfer of goods from road to sea, so that it more effectively benefits domestic sea transport by setting a cap on the amount of funding each application can receive, and reserving a portion of the allocation for transport within Norwegian territorial waters.
Ensure that the role of the transport sector as part of the total defense is taken into account in the work on the revision of the National Transport Plan.

Make a new assessment of Helfo's office structure based on real evaluations of efficiency gains, progress in digitalization, the risk of losing experiential competence, government guidelines for the placement of state workplaces, as well as the Parliament's directives as outlined in the majority remarks in Innst. 11 S (2018–2019), and report back to Parliament in an appropriate manner. Parliament requests the government to maintain the current office structure in Helfo until such a matter has been addressed by Parliament.

Follow up on the majority remark regarding Helfo's office structure from Innst. 11 S (2017–2018) by ensuring a more decentralized office structure in Helfo than what the government's decision of April 19, 2018, is based on.
Investigate the current petroleum tax system, including the exploration refund scheme, and report back to the Storting in an appropriate manner.

Investigate and propose a revenue-neutral scheme for VAT exemption for leisure boats with electric propulsion, and assess various solutions to compensate for the revenue loss, including increasing the base tax on mineral oil or implementing a CO2-differentiated one-time tax on leisure boats.

Promote proposals to gradually change the CO2 tax for the entire maritime sector, and promote proposals for the introduction of a CO2 tax without a refund scheme for the fishing fleet, with the possibility for the industry to enter into agreements based on the model of the NOX fund to implement reductions in emissions. The contributions will be differentiated based on vessel size, and the smallest part of the fishing fleet will be favored by increasing the fisher's deduction.
Promote a proposal for the introduction of a CO2-differentiated one-time tax on boats, to encourage energy efficiency and the use of low and zero-emission technology.

Propose changes to the tax regime for trucks with the aim of making it profitable to choose low- and zero-emission technology, and submit proposals for such changes in the draft national budget for 2020.
Promote a proposal to change the basic fee on beverage packaging for plastic bottles to an environmental tax on material use, graded according to the amount of recycled or renewable material.
Investigate a fee on the disposal of mineral resources to prevent emissions and achieve better utilization of resources from mining activities.

Make a new assessment of the approved changes in the taxation and reporting of non-cash benefits and return to the Parliament with a new proposal that takes into account the need for broad tax bases, reduced bureaucracy, and simplification of reporting.

Investigate measures that will result in the complete phase-out of biofuels with a high deforestation risk (such as palm oil), and in connection with the state budget for 2020, present a concrete proposal that will achieve this goal, facilitate the introduction of locally sourced advanced Norwegian biofuels, and that will not affect the pump price for consumers.
Reduce the capitalization rate in property tax for hydropower plants from 4.5% to 3% effective from 2019 until a new calculation system for this rate is in place.

Come back to the Parliament in connection with the state budget for 2020 with a predictable calculation system for the capitalization rate in property tax for hydropower plants that takes into account market interest rates and ensures that the rate under current conditions will be lower than the existing rate.
Propose the repeal of the maximum and minimum rules for property tax on power plants.
Come back with a plan that ensures that Norwegian municipalities can obtain cheaper loans by having the state guarantee the debt within the state budget for 2020.

Evaluate whether the current fee on natural gas of 1.02 NOK/Sm3 has a positive or negative environmental effect, given that it may hinder the transition from truck transport to sea transport of farmed fish and other goods, as well as result in refueling abroad. Additionally, return to the Parliament no later than in connection with the state budget for 2020 with this assessment.
Conduct a comprehensive review of access to venture capital in Norway, both public and private, and appropriately propose improvements.
Introduce the long-awaited SMB discount in capital adequacy requirements to strengthen the financing of SMB companies.
Investigate changes to the Value Added Tax Act that ensure healthcare professionals must include value added tax if they provide alternative treatment.

Investigate whether any of the members in the organizations currently registered in the register for alternative practitioners can be considered to provide health care, and return to the Parliament with a legislative proposal that allows them to be exempt from the Value Added Tax Act.

Amend the regulation on country-by-country reporting to ensure that where extended information is to be provided, it shall be given in accordance with the annual accounts and independent of the materiality threshold.
Propose to abolish the system of neutral VAT in healthcare enterprises in connection with the state budget for 2020.
Reduce the capitalization rate in property tax for hydropower from 4.5% to 4% effective from 2019 until a new calculation system is in place.
Abolish the Individual Pension Savings (IPS) scheme from 2019.

Promote proposals for amendments to the property tax law that exempts all owners of buildings that are either protected under the Cultural Heritage Act or designated for preservation under the Planning and Building Act from municipal property tax.

Consider how to ensure equal treatment of publicly listed and non-publicly listed companies in wealth tax, i.e., that their valuation does not systematically favor non-publicly listed companies as it does in the current system.

Investigate and propose alternative models for tax and fee reductions that can contribute to consistent and good maintenance of buildings that are either protected under the Cultural Heritage Act or designated for preservation under the Planning and Building Act.

Come back with a legislative proposal that provides municipalities merging into a new municipality with predictability for property tax revenues from hydropower, wind power, and processing plants, and that facilitates the continuation of these in the new municipality after the merger. The regulatory change must not lead to sudden increases in property taxes for residential properties, vacation homes, or commercial properties from one year to the next.

To return to the Parliament with a plan for a new and improved quota program for students from the Global South. The Parliament also asks the government for an assessment of whether the Panorama strategy should be adjusted.

Promote a proposal to enshrine a right and obligation for teachers to engage in further education and training, and no later than the state budget for 2020, present a plan for how such a right can be fulfilled.

Present a plan to strengthen the kindergarten teacher profession, including a proposal that 50% of the staff in kindergartens should have a kindergarten teacher education, as well as measures to ensure better funding for kindergarten teacher education, and return to the Parliament with a case no later than the state budget for 2020.
Come back to the Parliament with proposals on how study opportunities in Norway can be improved for students from the Global South through a strengthening of the NORPART program.

Ensure that exemptions from school subjects are not granted if they do not align with the wishes of the student and their guardians, that the exemption must be academically justified, and that the consequences of an exemption are clearly communicated to the student and their guardians.
Base the allocation on the same number of counties as in the previous distribution, so that Trøndelag does not end up disproportionately skewed.

Initiate negotiations with the supplier of the F-35 fighter jet to halt the procurement of fighter jets that have not yet been delivered to the Armed Forces or are planned for delivery in 2019, and instead prioritize the Armed Forces' defensive capabilities.
Terminate the stationing of American soldiers at Værnes and Setermoen.
Cancel the planned order in 2019 for six new fighter jets.
Reject Norway's accession to the UN's migration platform (Global Compact for Safe, Orderly and Regular Migration).
Accelerated the purchase of tanks for 2020 through the acquisition of a prototype in accordance with the recommendations from the Army Weapons School.
That new EDI measures will not be considered until the Parliament has reviewed the report on allied reception.
Create a post for peace information work under chapter 118 post 72, and propose an allocation of at least 6 million kroner in the revised national budget (RNB).

Investigate the possibility of establishing funds at the national level in conflict and post-conflict countries to ensure reparation and rehabilitation for victims of conflict-related sexual violence. This can be done in collaboration with the UN Secretary-General's Special Representative on Sexual Violence in Conflict, survivor networks, and civil society organizations that work on the issue nationally and locally in countries where sexual violence is used, or has been used, as a weapon of war. This is important to support survivors and contribute to prevention.
Ensure consistency between the focus on business promotion and human rights by prioritizing work on human rights in business assistance.

To maintain the current dedicated helicopter support to the Army and to continue the current level of readiness at Bardufoss with nine Bell helicopters. Squadron 339 will continue at Bardufoss with helicopter support to the Army as its main task. Strengthened helicopter capacity at Rygge will be realized through an increased number of flight hours, an increased number of operational crews, and increased planning capacity.

Follow up on the Storting's decision in the land forces proposition – prepared with the involvement and support of the governing parties through Innst. 50 S (2017–2018), cf. Prop. 2 S (2017–2018) – to ensure a real dedicated helicopter support for the Army at Bardufoss, to maintain a high readiness level in the Army's 2nd Battalion at Skjold, and to provide the Army with a modern tank capability available from 2019.
Investigate the possibility of introducing a modernized form of war injury pension in connection with the announced evaluation of the existing compensation and indemnity schemes for veterans.

Improving and streamlining the maintenance operations in the Armed Forces should not be based on privatization, but rather ensure the Armed Forces' need for flexibility, competence, and security, especially in times of crisis and war.

Respect the Norwegian labor model also for Defense employees, halt the planned rent increase for defense employees, and do not implement changes without reaching an agreement with the organizations representing defense employees.

Return to the Storting in an appropriate manner with a compilation of the experiences from the procurement process for NH90 helicopters and the already implemented and planned measures for future procurements in the defense sector, based on the experiences from the NH90 procurement.
Ensure helicopter capacity at the same level as today for the Army, while also maintaining the capacity in the south as planned.
Establish the necessary regulations to obtain real-time information on who has a legal work permit in Norway.
Contribute to making the facts about employment for the population as a whole and for different groups visible.
Establish a framework that grants young people in need of permanent adapted work (VTA) the right to such state-funded positions.

Maintain the current regulations regarding support for individuals with celiac disease and non-celiac gluten intolerance until a better professionally founded proposal can be presented in consultation with the user organization, effective from July 1, 2019.
Implement an activity reform with a job guarantee for young people on graded disability benefits.

Limit the tenders for the measures Clarification and Follow-up to include non-profit actors with a profit prohibition, with particular emphasis on organized wage and working conditions, quality, local circumstances, and proximity to users. The Parliament requests the government to return to the Parliament at an appropriate time during 2019 regarding how these adjustments to the measures have been implemented.
Investigate and present proposals for changes to the transition support scheme that provide real and completed skills enhancement that can be utilized in the labor market.
Ensure that Nav users who suddenly find themselves without income due to capacity issues at Nav automatically have their benefits extended until a new decision is made.

Invest significantly more in several measure places earmarked for AFT. This must be clearly stated in the allocation letter to the Directorate of Labor and Welfare, which must also outline a division of labor between Nav's own management and the measure organizers for AFT regarding the work on increasing employment attachment for individuals with reduced work capacity.

Amend § 17 (1) of the regulation on public approval of cleaning companies and the purchase of cleaning services so that only approved cleaning companies may legally offer cleaning services to the commercial and private markets.
Change the rules so that unemployed individuals under 30 years old who have started upper secondary education are given the opportunity to complete it while receiving unemployment benefits.

Ensure that Nav changes its practice regarding the accommodation guarantee in the workplace for individuals with disabilities, so that a written accommodation guarantee is provided no later than at the end of the clarification for work.
Introduce a system of health passports in the form of a lifelong certificate for individuals with lifelong disabilities.

Ensure that the National Association for Public Health can receive grants from the state budget's chapter 872 item 70, in line with other user and relative organizations, for its advocacy and peer support work for people with dementia.
Reintroduce the practice of presenting the social security settlements as a separate matter for the Storting, starting with the social security settlement for 2019.
Present a case for changing the regulatory principles for ongoing pensions from wage development minus 0.75% to the actual average of wage and price development.
Promote the necessary proposals to ensure that the organizations participating in the social security settlement have the right to negotiate.
Consider the possibilities for reprioritization within the framework set by the right to negotiate in the welfare settlement.

Propose changes to the housing support regulations to eliminate the backlog that has arisen since 2009 due to the lack of adjustment of housing costs, price levels, and consideration of the development of income levels in the low-income group.
Secure a digital e-voting solution for the municipal and county council elections in 2019, and based on these experiences, establish a permanent arrangement for local and parliamentary elections.
Reintroduce compensation for small-scale operational disadvantages through a uniform basic grant to all municipalities at the level of the grant that was provided until 2016.
Take the initiative to reach an agreement with Greece to accept a corresponding number of asylum seekers for processing in Norway as under the previous relocation mechanism.
Strengthen competence on gender and sexuality diversity and cultural competence in adult education by enhancing Skeiv Verdens' work in relation to adult education on this matter.
Present a proposal for stronger income equalization in the municipal sector.
Propose suggestions on how a maximum price scheme in the cultural school can be implemented.

Conduct a comprehensive review of the scheme for resource-intensive services and ensure that relevant costs incurred by municipalities, such as those arising from the quality regulations and early discharge of patients, are included in the basis for the municipal co-payment.
Present various models to increase the state's co-financing of particularly resource-intensive services and to extend it to also include patients who are over 67 years old and are part of the scheme.
Establish the necessary competence requirements in the municipal sector regarding the environment, biodiversity, and climate.
Establish a government interest compensation scheme for necessary investments in infrastructure in the municipal sector as a result of extreme weather.

Present a proposal for a housing support framework that ensures housing support for the disabled regardless of when the disability benefits were granted, and at approximately the same level as the housing support was before the restructuring of the disability benefits.

Ensure that crisis centers and other support measures for victims of violence in Sámi areas are provided with operational funding to support this group of victims until a new action plan against violence and abuse in Sámi communities is in place.
Initiate a new and larger trial with voting rights for 16-year-olds. It must be ensured that the largest cities are included in the scheme.
Establish a permanent compensation scheme for the loss of income resulting from changes in property tax on works and usage, ensuring nearly full compensation.

Come back to the Parliament with an evaluation of the experiences with the inclusion of grants to volunteer centers in the block grant and how this has developed, and propose a scheme where the grants are kept outside the block grant.
Develop a specific action plan against violence and abuse in the Sami communities.

Maintain the regional center grant as an economic tool also in future municipal mergers. The regional center grant goes to municipalities that merge and thus form a stronger focal point in their region. The grant is disbursed as it is today, following a national decision on the merger. It is assumed that the increased regional center grant will be financed within the municipal framework with a reduction in the population grant.
Ensure that the state uses procurement criteria that ensure Norwegian companies become more competitive.

Refrain from equating patients ready for discharge with mental health and substance abuse issues with patients ready for discharge with somatic health problems until a funding solution that adequately compensates the affected municipalities is in place.
To promote the establishment of a national pacemaker registry in Norway.

Ensure that the work on electronic message exchange in the municipalities continues after the discontinuation of state funding for KomUT, and that the municipalities are given time to adjust so that this work does not come to a halt.

Ensure that Helse Nord RHF reviews and modifies its implementation of the patient travel regulations, particularly regarding the patient's right to have expenses for taxi services or additional costs when using a car covered, especially when the lack of scheduled transport makes it necessary. In choosing the mode of travel, discretion must be exercised, with significant emphasis placed on distance, geographical and traffic conditions, and total travel time.
Do not carry out the proposed transfer of payment for medications from the National Insurance Scheme to the health enterprises.
Abolish activity-based funding in somatics.
To dismantle the corporate model in health management.
Investigate the need for national production capacity for the vaccines included in the childhood vaccination program.
Remove the limitation that prevents health nurses and midwives from having prescribing rights for all types of contraception for young people under 16 years old.
Ensure that manual therapists are included on par with chiropractors in the work to establish a five-year master's program.
Ensure that no significant changes are made to the emergency medical chain, pending a parliamentary report on the pre-hospital services.

Investigate whether the increased costs of obtaining authorization result in an economic loss for society due to foreign-educated healthcare personnel not utilizing their skills and labor resources in our shared healthcare service, and further assess the profitability of reducing the costs associated with obtaining authorization.
Reduce the share of activity-based funding in somatics to a maximum of 40 percent.

Come back to the Parliament with an overview of the number of armed actions the police have carried out in 2018, including how many police officers have been armed in the various actions, and whether the weapon has been actively used by drawing handguns from holsters or in any other way actively used in the use of force.
Facilitate the expansion of Vik and Hustad prisons, as well as the planning of the Sunnmøre Correctional Center and Ilseng prison.
Ensure that Molde courthouse has safe courtrooms.
Facilitate that duplication is not used in the criminal justice system.
Establish a committee to conduct a thorough analysis of the police's staffing and resource needs based on the development of tasks in recent years and analyses of the police's expected future tasks.

Ensure that as much of the budget funds allocated by the Parliament to the police as possible is directed to the operational budgets of the police districts, and that spending in the Police Directorate is limited.

Promote a bill that allows for a simplified personal investigation to be conducted in cases where charges have been brought against children between the ages of 15 and 18, when appropriate. A simplified personal investigation may involve the correctional services appearing as a witness in court instead of conducting a mandatory personal investigation of the minor (PUM) in advance, cf. the Criminal Procedure Act § 161 a first paragraph.
To ensure a comprehensive investigation of the consequences, the Osterøy department at Bergen prison is included in the ongoing KVU for the Correctional Services Region West.

Maintain the correctional facilities at Hassel prison, Arendal prison department Håvet, Hedmark prison department Bruvoll, Søndre Vestfold prison department Sandefjord, and Nordre Vestfold prison department Hof.
Conduct a follow-up evaluation of the pilot project with welfare bonds and report back to the Parliament in an appropriate manner.
Develop a national plan to establish regional training and preparedness centers for joint training and capacity building among emergency and preparedness agencies.
Strengthen the Film Fund financially.
Strengthen the film regions economically.
Set a goal of 50/50 women and men in key positions both in front of and behind the camera in Norwegian film, replacing the 40/60 goal.

Ensure that the Norwegian Film Institute presents a more binding action plan for increased gender equality in Norwegian film, as well as requiring regular reporting on goal achievement. This new action plan should include the following measures: The proposals for actions from the Industry Council for Film from 2010 that have not been implemented should be carried out. An attempt will be made over three years to increase post-production support for films with women in key positions, similar to how post-production support has been used to boost children's film production.
Promote a case for the Storting regarding the introduction of the co-financing scheme, in accordance with the directive on audiovisual media services, Article 13.
Conduct an evaluation of the reorganization of the National Archives by July 1, 2019.
Ensure the role and function of the state archivists as leaders of the state archives, responsible for budget, personnel, and professional quality.
Ensure the state responsibility for the archival field with the national archives as the most important regional actors in collaboration with other public and private archives.

Ensure safety and predictability for children in child welfare services by abolishing and replacing tender competitions and individual purchases of institutional placements through tenders with competence- and quality-based contracts, such as extended in-house management or other long-term and stable contract forms, and that non-profit actors are given priority over commercial actors, until commercial actors are out of child welfare services.

Propose changes to the legislation regarding child welfare to ensure that public funding fully benefits children in the child welfare system, and that this money does not go to profit for commercial child welfare actors.
End the use of outsourcing and tenders in the child welfare sector and ensure that private non-profit organizations have long-term agreements with the public sector.

Look at the use of individual purchases of institutional placements in child welfare, and report back to the Parliament in an appropriate manner by the end of 2019 with proposals for measures to reduce this practice.
Ensure that actors receiving public funding for the operation of child welfare measures have salary, working, and pension conditions in line with those applicable in public measures.
Ensure that all contract agreements related to petroleum developments that are to be processed by the Storting are postponed until the Storting has completed its review before they are finalized.

The following shall be the basis for development projects on the Norwegian continental shelf: The Storting (Norwegian Parliament) agrees that the Ministry of Petroleum and Energy may approve projects (plans for development/facilities and operations) on the Norwegian continental shelf in 2018 under the following conditions: The project must not have significant principled or societal implications. The upper limit for total investments per project is 7 billion Norwegian kroner. Each individual project must demonstrate acceptable socio-economic profitability and be reasonably robust against changes in the price development of oil and natural gas.

Conduct an evaluation of the scheme in accordance with the assumptions given in 2007, and this must also include an assessment of the consequences that the scheme with national salmon rivers and salmon fjords has for seafood production, the aquaculture industry, as well as other business activities.

Allocate more of the funds in chapter 1420, item 85 (Nature Information Centers) directly to the centers based on authorizations, in order to distribute resources from project writing and application processing to direct activities as neutral knowledge disseminators, in line with the brand 'Norway's National Parks'.

Consider introducing a grant scheme that covers the costs associated with the disposal of waste following voluntary cleanup actions. The scheme must be viewed in connection with the arrangement that has already been implemented related to marine littering and the spread of microplastics. The Parliament requests the government to present a case on this in connection with the revised national budget for 2019.
Allocate 1 million kroner for a preliminary project for the nature information center for Trillemarka-Rollagsfjell.

Come back to the Storting with the revised national budget for 2019 with a plan for how the state will contribute to the realization of a national nature information center for the boreal forest reserve, related to Trillemarka-Rollagsfjell in Eggedal.

Develop a phasing-out plan for how much hazardous waste can be deposited annually by minimizing the production of hazardous waste and through a strengthened focus on converting hazardous waste into resources, and establish a quantified realistic target that is higher than the EU targets by spring 2019.
Promote proposals on how different models for equalizing network tariffs in Norway can be designed and implemented.

Facilitate that Enova can provide support to housing cooperatives and that condominiums can receive support for charging infrastructure. The support scheme must be able to provide grants for the establishment/upgrade of electrical systems for charging electric and hybrid vehicles in residential companies, including cabling up to distribution cabinets in parking facilities and systems for load sharing.

Implement the Storting's resolution no. 753 of June 2, 2017, and request that the regulatory change comes into effect no later than July 1, 2019. Until the effective date, all allocation letters sent to public agencies and county municipalities shall stipulate as a condition that, due to deforestation risk, no purchases of fuel / liquid heating products containing palm oil products shall be made.

Present a case to the Storting in the revised national budget for 2019, with a comprehensive review of the instruments that contribute to a sustainable transition of society from a climate perspective.
Investigate and present a case to the Storting in the revised national budget for 2019 regarding a tax on the extraction of virgin natural resources.
Inform the Storting about the further work on the follow-up of the evaluation of national salmon rivers and salmon fjords.
Promote a proposal for a legislative change that ensures that county municipalities have full authority over the school structure in upper secondary education.
Increase the grants for decentralized higher education in the college and university sector and establish specific financial transfers to the county municipalities for this purpose.

Investigate the consequences for children, young people, and adults with special educational needs in the event of a potential transfer of Statped's responsibilities to the county municipalities and present this to the Parliament in an appropriate manner.
Propose that the county municipality takes over the tasks of the County Governor related to hunting permits for predators.
Present a proposal to transfer the authority to grant licenses for small hydropower plants (1–10 MW) and wind power (over 1 MW/five turbines) to the county municipalities.

Investigate a plan for how the following tasks and authority should be transferred to the regional elected level: 1. The responsibility for the state child welfare system through Bufetat 2. The responsibility for family counseling 3. The responsibility for the district psychiatric clinics - DPS 4. The regional apparatus of Innovation Norway 5. Parts of the Research Council's programs 6. Festival support from the Arts Council 7. Cultural heritage protection

Develop a plan for how all the County Governor's tasks that require political discretion are transferred to the county municipality, with the exception of land conservation, so that the County Governor becomes a purely supervisory, control, and appeals body.

Investigate under what conditions the county municipality, at the request of the municipalities, can consider stepping in as the regulatory planning authority for larger county infrastructure projects, what legal amendments and limitations should possibly be made, and present this to the Parliament for a final decision in an appropriate manner.

Follow up on the expert committee's recommendations and reconsider the organization of hospitals with the aim of transferring responsibility for hospitals and specialized outpatient clinics (DPS) to the new counties.
Develop a plan for how at least 98% of households will have access to a gigabit offer by 2025, and for how the entire country will have access to a gigabit offer by 2027.
Investigate a distribution model that ensures the minimum funding needs for the purchase of public transport routes, and present this to the Parliament before the next tender announcement.
Investigate which other tasks can naturally be transferred to the District Center to strengthen competence in community development and value creation in rural areas.
Further develop Nkom's role to also include national advisory services to achieve the goal of sustainable competition, and to stimulate business development and innovation.

Further investigate the transfer of tasks from the County Governor to the county municipalities in the area of climate and environment, with the exception of responsibilities for pollution, control, supervision, and complaints.
Give the county municipalities guidance responsibility regarding motorized traffic in uncultivated land.
Give the county municipalities a regional coordination responsibility in the climate area related to the implementation of the climate law.
Consider whether some of the responsibility for patient transport can be delegated to the new counties.
Propose increased funding for regional development to the county municipalities.
Strengthen the regional research funds.

Investigate further transfer of tasks from the County Governor to the county municipalities in the agricultural sector. A prerequisite for the transfer is that the agricultural agreement with national guidelines is not weakened.
Increase the rates for living expenses in reception centers within the framework of the allocation.
Ensure that the allocation to the Human Rights Service is not increased through the reallocation of the state budget for 2018.
Increase the grant for 2018 to the Holocaust Center and the Antiracist Center by 250,000 kroner, respectively.

Ensure that violations of the minimum wage regulations under the general application regulations and violations of the information/supervision obligation automatically result in the imposition of a fee.

Promote proposals on which of the measures in the freight package in the National Transport Plan 2018–2029 can be expedited and given a faster start to construction than what is outlined in the railway sector's action program.

Ensure that freight trains are prioritized on the railway network at night where it causes little or no significant route changes for passenger trains. The government is requested in this work to review the railway regulations and their implementation, in addition to existing timetables, and to report to the Parliament on what changes will be implemented once the work is completed.
