Present a plan for strengthening the Barents cooperation and civil cross-border collaboration in the Barents region, through a more long-term and enhanced funding model that ensures greater predictability and better framework conditions.
Start the work to realize the North Norway Railway.
Ensure Norwegian ownership of critical infrastructure and property, as well as national control over natural resources in the Arctic region.
Promote proposals that can help more people with reduced work capacity and accommodation needs to be employed.
Increase the number of permanent, adapted workplaces to strengthen the employment opportunities for disability pensioners.
Promote proposals that can help more people with reduced work capacity and accommodation needs to be employed, rather than relying on benefits and passivity.

Promote necessary legislative proposals to ensure the right to unemployment benefits and sick pay for the age group that is employed and covered by the pension reform, up to the age of 72, with a further increase in line with needs.

Use the data and reports presented by Nav in accordance with Chapter 4 of the Equality and Anti-Discrimination Act regarding the duty to promote and report, to propose necessary measures to ensure better equal treatment of employees in state and municipal Nav.

Come back with a plan that outlines what organizational changes and strengthening of professional expertise are needed among the agency's professionals so that the front line at Nav offices in municipalities and districts can make decisions regarding temporary benefits and employment-related measures in line with the original goals of the Nav reform. This is to ensure the need for empowered Nav offices in all municipalities and districts where the municipal council decides so.
Ensure that the front line at Nav is strengthened, so that each user is seen as an individual, and that Nav becomes less bureaucratic.
Promote the necessary legislative proposals to dissolve the partnership in Nav and place all benefits and services in Nav under one state governance line.
Establish a broadly composed committee to consider dissolving the partnership and consolidating all benefits and services in Nav under one state governance framework.
Secure Ekebergsletta as a state-protected outdoor recreation area.

To engage in dialogue with the parties in the labor market about wage development in occupational groups in critical societal functions, especially female-dominated professions, to determine what the state can contribute in terms of funding to ensure wage increases.

Promote measures for female-dominated professions that are particularly affected by the consequences of the coronavirus situation on the economy and labor market in both the short and long term, including measures for increased full-time employment, initiating long-term trials with reduced working hours, increasing staffing levels, and starting a dialogue with the parties about salary increases for female-dominated professions in the public sector, as well as specific measures within female-dominated industries in the private sector, such as service industries.
To secure financial resources for the action plan against violence in close relationships, and to return to the Parliament in connection with the revised national budget for 2021.
To present a long-term employment plan with targeted measures for groups that are particularly hard hit by unemployment.
Mapping discrimination and racism in the labor market to implement concrete measures for hiring processes and recruitment, with the aim of getting more people into jobs.

Ensure that the gender equality consequences of the coronavirus crisis, both in the short and long term, are examined, and that recommendations for measures to mitigate negative gender equality consequences are provided, for example by clarifying this in the mandate for the coronavirus commission.

Ensure that Norway takes on a leading role internationally to prevent the coronavirus situation from being used to hinder sexual and reproductive health and rights, such as abortion, and that development policy takes into account that women are particularly affected by the economic consequences of the pandemic.
Implement research that examines the gender equality consequences of the COVID-19 pandemic, and that looks at the crisis measures that have been introduced from a gender perspective.

Ensure that holders of a Class B driver's license also receive driving rights for Class A1. A prerequisite should be at least 2 years of Class B driving rights, as well as completion of a course with theory and practical training at a driving school.

Investigate whether it should be easier to obtain a motorcycle license for light motorcycles when one already has a car license. In such an investigation, questions related to traffic safety, greenhouse gas emissions, and other significant factors must be examined more closely.
Investigate an annual national maximum price for commuters who rely on public transport such as buses, trams, subways, and trains, and report back to the Parliament in an appropriate manner.
Introduce post-payment for AutoPASS for ferries, with a deposit amount, similar to the arrangement with AutoPASS for tolls.
Introduce an annual national maximum price for commuters who rely on ferry and fast boat services.
Propose to make all national and county road ferries free, and compensate the counties for the corresponding loss of income.

Introduce a scheme for free ferry and fast boat services for communities without road connections to the mainland, and consider making all ferry routes with fewer than 100,000 passengers annually free of charge.
Introduce a scheme for free ferry and boat services for residents in communities without road connections to the mainland.
Present a plan for how the ferry and fast boat services along the coast can be secured and improved.
Reduce the advance payment amount for AutoPASS for the ferry to NOK 1,100.
Investigate and propose to introduce the same tax benefits for electric boats as for electric cars.
Establish an expert unit with specialized knowledge in green public procurement that will assist the state, municipalities, and local communities.
Introduce requirements for zero emissions on all short sea routes and zero or low emissions on all longer routes.

Propose the gradual implementation of zero-emission criteria in new public tenders for ferry services. Furthermore, the government is requested to propose the gradual implementation of zero-emission criteria in new public tenders for fast ferries and to present a plan for the gradual implementation of both zero-emission and low-emission criteria for other shipping in new public tenders. The Parliament also requests the government to present a plan for the introduction of requirements for zero-emission and low-emission in other shipping.
Propose a national port plan for how ports should be equipped to contribute to business development and efficient green logistics solutions.

Investigate a new concession system for cruise ships, with strict environmental requirements for sailing along the coast and fjords, and requirements for the use of local food and expertise. Concessions should be granted with demands for low emissions and zero emissions in the long term.

Establish an expert unit within maritime climate and environmental technology and maritime procurement, which counties and government agencies can benefit from in their purchases of ships. It should be considered whether the supplier development program can take on this role. The unit will also be responsible for developing a "best practice" for tenders, where it is assessed whether both construction and operation should be included in the same tender.
Strengthen the subsidy scheme for Norwegian seafarers by permanently removing the current caps/limitations in the scheme.
Initiate the work to enshrine the substance of the current subsidy scheme for Norwegian seafarers in law to ensure necessary predictability.
Simplify the subsidy scheme for Norwegian seafarers by reducing the number of subsidy models from eight to three models.

Work to ensure that ships with transport assignments in new maritime industries in Norwegian waters and on the Norwegian continental shelf should also be included in the subsidy scheme for Norwegian seafarers.

Establish a national sector agreement between businesses, authorities, support systems, research environments, and other parts of the maritime cluster to ensure that Norway develops industry, expertise, jobs, and exportable technology for floating offshore wind. A national goal of at least 3 GW of installed capacity by 2030 should be set.
Strengthen Statkraft's equity to build a foundational infrastructure for the production and distribution of green hydrogen.

Set requirements for lower emissions from the offshore fleet and from vessels used in aquaculture, including subcontractors. The requirement must be formulated in a way that ensures a gradual phasing in of the best available technology.

Consider imposing stricter requirements on shipping companies that receive subsidies through the employment support scheme for seafarers, to contribute with practical training in relevant educational programs.

Ensure that permission is not granted to carry cargo or passengers between Norwegian ports or to operate on a regular route with passengers between Norwegian and foreign ports for ships registered in the Norwegian International Ship Register.

Follow up on the recommendations from the joint maritime committee, in the report dated March 19, 2021, and propose measures that establish the principle that Norwegian wage and working conditions should apply for work on the Norwegian continental shelf and in Norwegian waters.

Ensure that requirements for Norwegian wage and working conditions are imposed on those who work on board supply, standby, and anchor handling vessels related to rights holders, operators, and others participating in activities on the Norwegian continental shelf covered by the Petroleum Act.
Make visible and utilize the scope of action in the EEA Agreement with the aim of ensuring that a larger share of the value creation from public contracts benefits the Norwegian maritime industry.
Present a strategy to ensure that public construction contracts within the maritime sector are awarded to Norwegian shipyards to the greatest extent possible.

Ensure that the new agency Export Financing Norway receives an expanded mandate that can more significantly contribute to financing new export opportunities. The mandate must, among other things, facilitate an increase in the company's own share in projects where this is reasonable.
Establish a government investment program for scaling up technologies for the maritime industry. The program should help create new export opportunities and jobs, and trigger private investments.
Extend the construction loan scheme with a 50% advance guarantee for ships that are not to be exported.

Consider arrangements that can contribute to a green transition, such as a top financing scheme and a scheme for environmentally friendly recycling of offshore ships and rigs. The arrangements must be designed to generate activity in the Norwegian shipbuilding industry.
Come back to the Parliament with a strategy to renew the fishing fleet, which is developed in collaboration with the industry (based on the model of the climate agreement with agriculture).
Ensure that the county municipal income system compensates for the additional costs of adopting low- and zero-emission technology in the procurement of ferries and fast boats.
Come back to the Parliament with a national plan to make land and charging power, hydrogen, ammonia, and other green fuels available.
Investigate the possibility of establishing a school ship in Northern Norway.
Facilitate low-emission tourism by ensuring night train connections to other countries and providing good public transport solutions that take tourists to the UNESCO World Heritage fjords.
Make regulatory changes that reverse the amendments to the NIS regulations, so that NIS-registered ships can no longer operate in cruise traffic along the Norwegian coast or in Svalbard.
Give municipalities the opportunity to only allow cruise ships with Norwegian wage and working conditions in their ports.

Introduce requirements for the use of zero-emission technology on all cruise ships in Norwegian territorial waters. Exceptions are granted for NOR-registered vessels, which are to be emission-free in the UNESCO World Heritage fjords from 2026 and throughout Norway's territorial waters by 2030.

Ensure that Nav and the agricultural trade unions collaboratively develop a systematic program aimed at students and high schools, which secures recruitment and training of youth for summer jobs in agriculture.
Present a scheme for grants for tree planting. The scheme should cover the entire planting season of 2021 and be designed based on the model of the scheme in 2020, with a grant of NOK 1.50 per plant.
Ensure that the police helicopters take over the counter-terrorism preparedness for the police, as the Bell helicopters at Rygge have today.

Ensure that a minimum of 3 Bell helicopters, including personnel equivalent to 4 crew members as well as support staff/technicians, are relocated back to Bardufoss, in addition to the existing unit at Bardufoss.
Ensure that the Army has helicopter support and maintain competence both in the Army and in the tactical helicopter environment.

Conduct a comprehensive review of the guardianship system, including assessing alternatives such as a decision-support scheme in line with the CRPD, and present proposals for legislative changes that strengthen and improve the legal framework for the individuals the system is intended to cover.
Conduct a comprehensive review of the guardianship system and present proposals for legislative changes that strengthen and improve it.

Make the necessary regulatory and/or rule changes so that the reporting and payment of value-added tax for construction and civil engineering activities is suspended until disputed claims are clarified, and provide the necessary budgetary follow-up as soon as possible and no later than in connection with the state budget for 2022.
Ensure that municipalities that make local decisions to reduce the municipal portion of the wealth tax are not compensated either through the income system or in any other way.
Promote necessary proposals for changes in laws, regulations, and rules to ensure that parliamentary decision no. 622 is followed up. The Parliament must be presented with this by November 1, 2021.

Promote proposals that ensure funding for the additional expenses that the municipal sector incurs due to changes in the regulation of public service pensions. The funding should be presented in connection with the revised national budget for 2021.

Follow a calculation method for pension adjustments in 2021 and compensation for 2020 based on actual figures from the Technical Calculation Committee for Income Settlements (TBU) and not based on old estimates.
Present the necessary proposals to ensure that Storting resolution no. 618 is made applicable with effect from the social security settlement in 2021.
Ensure that the rate used is 10.2% of the paid unemployment benefits during the calculation period.
Ensure that there is no requirement that one must have received unemployment benefits for at least 8 weeks.
Ensure that holiday pay is calculated for unemployment benefits received throughout 2020 and 2021.
Ensure that a cap on holiday pay is not introduced, as the calculation basis is the total amount of unemployment benefits received in 2020 and 2021, respectively.

Reintroduce the holiday supplement for unemployment benefits effective from January 1, 2020, so that unemployment benefits earned in 2020 entitle recipients to a holiday supplement in 2021 according to the rules that applied before 2015.
Terminate Norway's participation in ILO Convention No. 169 on Indigenous and Tribal Peoples in Independent Countries.
Promote a proposal to repeal the Finnmark Act.
Investigate and promote the necessary proposals that result in all settlement-related land in Finnmark being transferred from the Finnmark Estate to the municipalities immediately.
Investigate and promote the necessary proposals that will result in today's unregistered land in Finnmark being registered as real estate.

Investigate and promote the necessary proposals so that the areas currently included in the Finnmark Estate, along with Statskog's lands in Nordland and Troms, come under a legally similar status as the state's uncultivated lands in the rest of the country.
Investigate and promote the necessary proposals for the dissolution of the Sámi Parliament.
Promote the necessary proposals to dissolve the administrative area for Sámi languages, cf. the Act on the Sámediggi and other Sámi legal matters (the Sámi Act) chapter 3.
Ensure that exemptions from the protection of cultivated and arable land can only be granted by a national planning authority.

Propose changes to the Agricultural Land Act that provide real protection for cultivated and arable land through a significant tightening of the possibilities for exemptions from the general requirement that cultivated and arable land should not be used for purposes other than food production.
Present a separate land protection strategy with measures to achieve the land protection goal.

Formulate a goal for the reallocation of arable land, assess whether the current criteria for reporting reallocation are sufficient, and develop measures that will reduce agriculture's own consumption of topsoil.
Present an action plan to strengthen the goat industry as a food producer and cultural bearer in Norway.
Promote a proposal for a change in the law so that it is the adult child themselves who assesses what is in their best interest in cases of stepparent adoption of adult children.
Ensure that the opinion of the mature child is given greater weight in cases of adult stepchild adoption.
Propose necessary legislative changes to abolish the reduction of pensions based on marital status.

Establish a simplification and modernization committee that will review and propose changes to the labor protection legislation. The goal of the changes is to make the legislation more user-friendly for companies, union representatives, and employees. Additionally, the government is requested to incorporate into the committee's mandate that it should look at simplifications and changes that better facilitate a more flexible labor market.

Establish a simplification and modernization committee that includes stakeholders from the labor market, which will review and propose linguistic changes to the labor protection legislation. The goal of the changes is to make the legislation more user-friendly for companies, union representatives, and employees.

Ensure that environmental requirements are included in all needs and requirements specifications for tender competitions in Nav, stating that suppliers must offer zero-emission vehicles for group 2 cars.
Ensure that the subsidies for purchasing group 1 cars through Nav are doubled when purchasing zero-emission vehicles, and promote any necessary proposals to secure this.
Investigate the legal establishment of liability for employers in cases of violation of the protective provision in the Equality and Anti-Discrimination Act § 13, sixth paragraph.
Section 13 of the Act on Gender Equality and Prohibition of Discrimination is incorporated into the Working Environment Act § 13-1, which concerns protection against discrimination.

Propose changes to the Working Environment Act so that the employer's responsibility to prevent and address sexual harassment in the workplace is clearly stated in Section 4-3 of the Working Environment Act, and ensure that references to the harassment provisions in the Gender Equality and Anti-Discrimination Act are included in the same paragraph.

Make it clear to Avinor that a break in the co-location of the Main Rescue Center and the control center at Sola cannot be accepted, and that the relocation of the control center and air traffic controllers to Røyken must not happen.

Investigate various causes of overrepresentation in infection rates among the immigrant population. Special attention should be given to assessing the relationship between travel activities and infection.
Consider lifting entry restrictions for individuals who can provide proof from their country's authorities that they are fully vaccinated.
Consider further restrictive measures to reduce travel to and from Norway to areas with persistently high infection risk.

Task the Corona Commission with investigating the capacity challenges in the healthcare system, including the backlog and consequences that need to be addressed in the healthcare system after the pandemic.
Task the Corona Commission with investigating the connections between financing solutions, such as unit price financing, and the preparedness capacity of health enterprises.

Task the Corona Commission with investigating the consequences of the use of part-time work, hiring, and extensive use of temporary workers in the healthcare system on preparedness and the ability to manage the pandemic.
Task the Corona Commission with investigating the long-term negative consequences that the government's pandemic management may have in the parts of the labor market that have been hardest hit.

Task the Corona Commission with investigating the pandemic's impact on services in municipalities, with particular focus on which services have been deprioritized or reduced, and the consequences for those who need these services.
Task the Corona Commission with investigating whether the control of employers' handling of imported infection has been sufficient.

Task the Corona Commission with investigating whether the social arrangements related to the coronavirus pandemic have provided adequate support, and what serious shortcomings these arrangements have had that must be addressed in the event of a similar crisis in the future.

Initiate an independent investigation into the government's efforts to secure vaccines for the Norwegian population and compare this with comparable countries outside the EU, such as Israel and the United Kingdom.
Initiate an independent investigation into the vaccine rollout strategy, including priorities and pace.

Ensure that the Corona Commission conducts a thorough assessment of the need for bed capacity and intensive care preparedness in the healthcare institutions, and based on that, make recommendations on how much capacity and staffing should be increased to prepare hospitals for any potential future pandemics.

Ensure that the Corona Commission conducts a thorough assessment of the situation for municipal chief physicians and municipal infection control doctors during the pandemic and promotes proposals for necessary measures for adequate recruitment and stabilization in this part of the service.

Establish an expert group to review the consequences of the coronavirus pandemic and the infection control measures for the elderly and individuals with disabilities, and to promote concrete proposals on how efforts should be strengthened moving forward.

Stop the economic compensation to EEA citizens residing in other EEA countries until control regimes are established to ensure that no one receives full compensation from Norwegian taxpayers while also having income from work or other support schemes in the country they are residing in. This is to ensure a more equal control regime as that which is in place for Norwegian recipients of sickness benefits and unemployment benefits.
Develop a proposal for a financial compensation scheme for gun owners affected by a retroactive ban on certain types of firearms, and return to the Parliament with this.

Promote a proposal for a legally mandated system of quota deductions based on the Icelandic model for the capture of fish that is exported, frozen or fresh, without having been processed on land in Norway.

Promote a case with measures that can ensure the landing of farmed fish in Norway in the future, including measures based on the quota draw system in Iceland and other measures suitable for stopping the development represented by "Norwegian Gannet," where Norwegian farmed fish are slaughtered on board the boat before being delivered abroad.
Propose measures that ensure increased processing of Norwegian wild and farmed fish in Norway. Measures such as quota reductions, taxes, and other initiatives should be considered.
Come back to the Parliament with a plan to phase out the production subsidy for the so-called opinion-forming national newspapers.
Include a reduction in funding for NRK in the proposal for next year's national budget.
Ensure national production and preparedness for critically important infection control equipment.
Provide investment grants to Norwegian manufacturers of infection control equipment.
Ensure that the consideration for national production of emergency products is given greater weight in the tender processes.
Establish emergency agreements with Norwegian production environments for the production of protective equipment.
Present a plan to ensure that the salaries of senior executives in companies and enterprises with state ownership do not exceed the salary of the Prime Minister.

Conduct a new power and democracy investigation to examine how power and influence are distributed and spread in Norwegian society, in line with the power investigation from 2003. The investigation should explicitly include assessments of power relations in the labor market, as well as the influence of economic special interests, judicial bodies, expert organizations, and think tanks on politics and societal development.

Strengthen the measures for increased settlement and activity in rural areas, including that regional policy considerations should be fundamental in economic policy, strengthen municipal finances with a stronger rural profile and to combat social inequality and living conditions challenges, a proximity reform for the public sector, ensure state funding for the facilitation and coordination of decentralized higher education, expansion of broadband/5G across the country, and to utilize the entire scope of the EEA agreement to provide direct business support and differentiated employer contributions.

Acknowledge the organized labor market and carry out a major cleanup in the labor market, among other things by promoting seriousness requirements for all public procurements, significantly increasing the union deduction, reintroducing the collective right to sue, and removing the general access to temporary employment.

Present calculations in the state budget for 2022 that illustrate the consequences for a typical family's real income after tax if various reforms for reduced working hours in the coming decades are financed through increased progressive taxation.

Present calculations in the state budget for 2022 that illustrate the consequences for a typical family's real income after tax if an enhancement of the standard of public welfare services in the coming decades is financed through increased progressive taxation.

Establish a committee to conduct a comprehensive investigation of the tax system with the aim of better utilizing existing tax bases, implementing new tax bases, and evaluating models for a green tax shift.

Ensure that socio-economic analyses of infrastructure projects in Norway price greenhouse gas emissions at the same level as in Sweden, and also include emissions from drained peatlands and any other emissions that are not accounted for.

Start the work on developing a development program for Northern Norway that includes tax and fee reductions, infrastructure investments, strengthening of targeted economic measures, significantly reduced prices for flights, ferries, and fast boats, restoration of Andøya Air Station, and re-establishment of Troms and Finnmark as separate counties.

Establish a public inquiry into the labor market, among other things, to shed light on how internationalization, labor immigration, changes in business, and technological development affect the power dynamics between the parties in the labor market, and to promote proposals that contribute to the parties being able to continue their cooperation based on equal strength. The inquiry will investigate and document the consequences of unregulated labor immigration through the EEA on the Norwegian labor market, including issues related to wages and working conditions and productivity development within various industries.
Introduce a salary freeze for high-paid executives in the state and establish a broadly composed low-income commission to investigate how real incomes are distributed in Norway.
Ensure and strengthen national ownership of strategically important companies, natural resources, and infrastructure, including by presenting proposals to strengthen the concession legislation.

Halt all ongoing centralization processes in the state and present a comprehensive plan for how the state, through increased local presence, can contribute to strengthening service offerings and preparedness close to people throughout Norway.
Ensure a review of all supplementary benefits to the income security schemes from Nav and the municipalities, with the aim of merging several benefits to streamline and simplify the case processing.
Establish an annual immigration account based on the model of the Immigration Account prepared by CEFOS in Denmark.

Create an overview that highlights the total integration debt that the state has incurred related to immigration over the past decades, as well as calculations of how much the integration debt will increase with the estimated reception of quota refugees, asylum seekers, and family reunifications in the coming years.

Conduct a comprehensive review of the structure of government directorates and agencies, and propose changes to simplify, streamline, and reduce bureaucracy. The review and proposed measures will be presented to the Parliament in connection with the state budget for 2022.
Establish a national council for just transition where the parties in the labor market play a central role.
Reduce economic disparities by increasing the wealth tax and the valuation of shares, operating assets, and commercial real estate to 80%.

Acknowledge the organized labor market and carry out a major cleanup in the labor market, among other things by promoting seriousness requirements for all public procurements, doubling the union deduction, reintroducing the collective right to sue, and removing the general access to temporary employment.

Promote proposals for powerful measures in the state budget for 2022 that ensure we increase non-oil and gas exports by 50% by 2030. Relevant measures include sector-specific agreements between businesses, trade unions, and authorities that commit to focusing on areas with the greatest export potential; industrial partnerships at the governmental and sector level with other countries and the EU; simplification of the support system to make it easier and more accessible, and making export promotion a core task in the foreign service and public administration.

Present a cost evaluation of all the reforms of the Solberg government over the past eight years. The evaluation must specify the costs of implementing the reforms and the results per year, as well as the expected effects in the coming years.

Ensure that the community receives its share of the future benefits from investments made possible wholly or partially by subsidies provided by the state for green transition. Subsidies can take the form of both tax advantages and direct support. As part of the goal to ensure that the community benefits, the government will establish an expert committee to examine the structure of direct and indirect subsidies to promote green transition, and how these can be designed to ensure that the community participates in future returns made possible through green subsidies.
Report on the development of social mobility in Norway annually in connection with the presentation of the national budget.

Conduct an evaluation of the exemption method, highlighting the distribution effects of this method, as well as exploring other possible alternatives to the exemption method that better take distribution considerations into account.
Reduce economic disparities by lowering income tax for average and low incomes.
Increase the government's efforts in the investment in carbon capture, transport, utilization, and storage, offshore wind, hydrogen, battery technology, and green shipping.

Postpone the implementation of the new E10/rv. 85 Tjeldsund-Gullesfjordbotn-Langvassbukt and reallocate the state funds for the realization of the Northern Norway Railway to ensure a future-oriented transport corridor for the seafood industry in the region, in addition to better maintenance and upgrading of existing national and county roads along the route to increase traffic safety.
Reclassify county road 359 in Vestfold and Telemark county to a national road and carry out the Kaste–Stoadalen project in Nome municipality with full state funding.
Introduce a guiding staffing and competence standard in Nav, which ensures sufficient social professional competence within the agency and among employees at the local level.

Promote a case for a review of the challenges in Nav to ensure that Nav provides good services to the population. In this context, it must be assessed whether Nav has sufficient financial resources to carry out its societal mission.
Ensure that Nav is equipped to operate effective job placement in close collaboration with employers in both the private and public sectors.
Ensure better offers for those who need permanently adapted work (VTA), as well as present a plan for the gradual increase of VTA positions.

Ensure better coordination of services in the healthcare sector, NAV, and the education system, so that young people receive comprehensive support tailored to the individual, with a focus on activity and mastery.
Ensure that the local Nav offices in municipalities and districts can provide residents with professional assistance with at least the same opening hours as the municipality's town hall.

Ensure that all of the country's Nav offices have daily opening hours that provide users who cannot or are not comfortable using digital and self-service solutions with access to a Nav office, so that equal services can be offered to everyone across the country.
Promote proposals for national guidelines that ensure the most vulnerable users have access to an available and open Nav.
Ensure sufficient capacity at the Nav contact center to avoid unnecessarily long response times.
Consider whether there is a need for a special arrangement for the "oil pioneers" similar to what has previously been implemented for the North Sea divers and veterans in foreign service.

Promote a proposal for a comprehensive reform of the occupational injury area by simplifying the current laws and regulations from two to one law (the Act on Occupational Injury Insurance) as well as updating the list of occupational diseases.

Propose changes to the occupational injury regulations so that they are in line with the societal developments that have occurred over the past 30 years, including a simplification of the current regulations from two to one clear set of rules and an update of the occupational disease list.
Promote a proposal to amend the National Insurance Act so that the Labor and Welfare Administration has the burden of proof in cases of occupational injury.
Promote a proposal to amend the Occupational Injury Insurance Act so that the insurer has the burden of proof in cases of occupational injury.

Promote a proposal to amend the financial institutions legislation so that membership in the Guarantee Scheme becomes mandatory for insurance sold cross-border from EEA countries to cover the insured's risk in Norway.
Review current practices and propose necessary changes to ensure that foreign workers in Norway have the same rights in case of occupational injuries as Norwegian workers do.

Ensure that the Norwegian Labour Inspection Authority and the police have sufficient competence and resources to monitor that the wage, working, insurance, and living conditions of foreign workers comply with Norwegian regulations and standards, so that illegal conditions can be uncovered before serious accidents occur, and that the accidents that do happen are adequately documented and investigated.

Present a proposal for the necessary simplification of the occupational injury regulations that aligns with the developments in society and the labor market, and that ensures the protection of individual workers. The Parliament also requests the government to review and, if necessary, update the list of occupational diseases.

Establish a commission to develop a compensation scheme for the "oil pioneers." The commission must ensure verification of the extent and damages, as well as a definition of what will be included in the compensation scheme. The commission will consist of independent experts as well as representatives of affected parties, including representatives from relevant employer and employee organizations and organizations representing the occupationally injured "oil pioneers," such as the National Association of Occupationally Injured (A.L.F.). Due to the fact that the "oil pioneers" have been affected by an injustice dating back a long time, it is urgent to clarify the compensation scheme. The commission is expected to complete its work by the end of December 2022.
Promote a proposal to introduce a national ban on the use of hijab in kindergartens and primary schools.

Ensure the expansion of the right to upper secondary education and grant students graduating from upper secondary school in the spring of 2021 the right to education until they have completed and passed upper secondary education with general or vocational competence.

Propose an obligation for the county municipalities to work systematically and preventively with students at risk of failing subjects in the spring of 2021, and suggest that an extended right to upper secondary education means that students who do not pass subjects should receive additional training during their educational journey.

Ensure that students who do not have a sufficient academic level from junior high school are offered the necessary introduction to Norwegian, English, and mathematics that will provide them with the competence needed to be a student in upper secondary school.

Promote a proposal to allocate the additional resources necessary for municipalities and county municipalities to provide a comprehensive offer to all students who need extra time to complete and pass upper secondary education due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Promote a proposal to introduce a new right to an apprenticeship or an equivalent offer as part of the Education Act for apprentices who lost their apprenticeship during the school year 2020/2021.

Come back as soon as possible with proposals for measures and extended rights that ensure that students who do not pass subjects or lose their apprenticeship in the spring of 2021 are guaranteed extended rights to education without using their youth rights.
Promote a proposal to implement a four-year plan for the gradual introduction of free full-day care in after-school programs for all children from 1st to 4th grade.
Introduce interest-free loans for necessary investments to implement free after-school care (SFO) nationwide and promote necessary proposals for this.
Ensure that the after-school program has enough staff and the necessary competence to provide the children with a high-quality after-school service.

Present a parliamentary report on how the quality of after-school programs (SFO) can be improved, and initiate the work on a quality plan to ensure competence and development in the after-school program. The report should address how free after-school programs can foster a community with play, physical activity, healthy food, culture, and a varied offering for all children, regardless of their parents' income and background.
Promote a proposal for a statutory right to sibling moderation in after-school care (SFO) and between SFO and kindergarten.

Initiate a pilot project in collaboration with KS, where municipalities are invited to implement more full-time positions for employees working in after-school programs (SFO), in addition to strengthening the collaboration between schools and SFO. The project will examine whether this can help enhance the quality in both schools and SFO, as well as provide better working conditions for employees. The Parliament requests the government to introduce arrangements for rewarding municipalities that participate, and additionally to conduct a follow-up evaluation of the pilot projects.

Facilitate increased collaboration between after-school programs and the cultural school, volunteer organizations, and local businesses and industries, which can support the school's broad view of knowledge and competence.

Initiate a project to research and develop a pedagogy tailored for five- and six-year-olds in school that unites play and learning, ensuring that children have a better transition from kindergarten to school.

Follow up on the conclusions from the knowledge overview regarding studies on the relationship between teaching methods and learning outcomes, as well as what characterizes good and learning-promoting assessment practices for the youngest students.
Gather research on what types of play can lead to which forms of learning.
Abolish all use of assessments where the youngest students are required to self-evaluate and evaluate their peers and teachers, including the use of so-called "smiley and frowny face assessments."
Return to the Parliament with a proposal to legislate the municipalities' responsibility for guided practice for health and social care students in municipal enterprises.

Ensure that changes to the regulations on self-payment at universities and colleges do not undermine the principle of free education in higher education or compromise the goal of lifelong learning for all.
Present the announced strategy for flexible and decentralized education to the Parliament.

Introduce a new mandatory price information/unit price for electricity, so that consumers can easily compare prices across all types of contracts, thereby ensuring that consumers can make informed choices.
Introduce a requirement that electricity companies must inform electricity customers in good time and through clearly labeled information when changing agreements.

Introduce mandatory information about the minimum duration of the price of an electricity agreement. This price information should be provided on the electricity bill and in all sales and marketing of electricity.
Promote a proposal to introduce an independent right to take leave for all fathers/co-mothers, initially for a leave equivalent to the father's quota.
Promote proposals for changes to laws and regulations so that it is up to each individual couple how they want to distribute parental leave between themselves.
Promote proposals for more flexibility in how parental leave is taken.

Conduct an evaluation of the parental leave scheme that came into effect on July 1, 2018. The evaluation should primarily focus on parents' experiences, the child's perspective, health consequences for the mother, as well as experiences with breastfeeding as a result of the changes in the father and mother quotas.
Promote a proposal that fathers are granted the right to take parental leave on an independent basis.
Investigate with a view to introducing a ban on all use of rubber granulate.
Investigate with a view to introducing a ban on all use of rubber granulate on new artificial turf fields from 2023, and a ban on the use of rubber granulate from 2025.
Investigate and implement a ban on the reprocessing of used tires and on all new use of bonded rubber granulate where there is a risk of exposure and leaching.

Come to the Parliament with a proposal for a compensation scheme for those affected by a ban on all use of loose rubber granulate, as well as with an assessment of alternatives to rubber granulate and any potential Norwegian business initiatives related to this.

Present a proposal for a compensation scheme for affected sports teams and clubs for additional expenses triggered by new requirements for the operation and maintenance of sports fields, based on the new Chapter 23A in the regulation on amendments to the regulation on the limitation of pollution (design and operation of sports fields where plastic-containing loose fill material is used) (FOR-2021-04-07-1096).
Come back to the Parliament with a proposal that oil companies are required to develop as much offshore wind as they need for electrification, as well as to pay for these investments.
Present a plan for the electrification of the continental shelf using offshore wind power.
Stop further electrification of the Norwegian continental shelf with power from the mainland.
Stop all further adaptation to the EU's energy regulations and adaptation to the EU's energy agency ACER.
Reject any processing of upcoming legislative acts related to the EU's energy market package 3 or 4.
Start the process of withdrawing Norway from the EU's energy agency (ACER).
Stop all transfer of power over the energy sector to the EU, and begin the work of increasing Norwegian sovereignty in the area again.
Use the veto right in the EEA against the transfer of authority in the EU's Clean Energy Package.

Come back to the Parliament with an assessment of the legal acts in the energy sector that have not yet been incorporated into the EEA Agreement, such as the Energy Performance of Buildings Directives and the Energy Efficiency Directives, and how corresponding national regulations can be implemented outside the EEA Agreement.
Investigate and return to the Storting in connection with the revised national budget 2021 with a proposal for a fair and user-financed equalization scheme for grid fees.
Ensure that those who receive housing support and do not have reduced expenses as a result of the new equalization scheme for electricity grid fees are compensated for it.
Come back to the Storting with a model for equalization of transfer tariffs that ensures more equal grid fees across the country.
Investigate how Norwegian authorities can facilitate a more open and democratic process in the handling of EEA-relevant laws and regulations.

Ensure a good educational offer in the higher education sector by completing the work on the changes to the regulations regarding degrees and professional education, protected titles, and standard study duration at universities and colleges (the degree regulations).

Postpone the mergers of directorates and return to the Parliament with a proposal for a model where the number of directorates and underlying entities is effectively reduced, with a clear transfer of tasks to the institutions and a clear allocation of responsibilities within the ministry.
Remove the degree regulation's limitation on educational institutions' ability to offer vocational training with protected titles.

Change the regulations regarding the limitation of educational institutions' ability to offer vocational education with protected titles, such as medicine, to include more study locations, starting with the University of Stavanger.
Consider the need for increased funding for NOKUT, as the agency will have an expanded responsibility to assess and ensure the quality of new educational programs.
Strengthen the regional responsibility of universities and colleges and consider incorporating regional responsibility into allocation letters and development agreements.
Incorporate specific escalation plans for new study places and scholarships in connection with the revision of the long-term plan for research and higher education.
Present the interdepartmental report on medical education to the Parliament.
Investigate measures to prevent dropout and delays in studies for students in higher education.
Return to the Storting with initial measures to secure more study places in medicine, health sciences, nursing, and psychology.

Develop a scaling plan for study places in medicine, health sciences, nursing, and psychology. The plan should include concrete measures for the establishment of sufficient study places at educational institutions, as well as measures that ensure students have practical placements in the healthcare sector. The plan should also include initiatives that make it attractive for healthcare workers to remain in the sector.
Introduce a requirement of passing primary school to start high school, in practice by ensuring that students have at least a grade of 2 in Norwegian and mathematics.
Strengthen the grant enhancement scheme for equipment in upper secondary schools.

Facilitate the establishment of permanent systems where companies report their need for apprentices to the training offices. These figures should be the basis when the county council develops the education offerings, so that the education provided aligns with the needs of the labor market.
Ensure continued increases in the apprenticeship grant and aim for it to eventually be at the same level as the cost of a vocational school place.
Promote a proposal to eliminate the employer's contribution for apprenticeship positions.

Implement a pilot program in several counties, where the state, industry, and school owners collaborate in a joint effort to provide mobile devices with technical equipment, following the model of Norwegian Industry.

Strengthen the counseling and guidance services in schools by facilitating an interdisciplinary counseling service and collaboration between the school owner, lower secondary school, counseling services, upper secondary school, and the labor market, and make it easier for professionals with experience from other fields to be employed in schools as counselors.

Facilitate the introduction of requirements for minimum standards for technical equipment in vocational education. The minimum standards should be developed in collaboration between schools and the business sector.
Take the initiative to increase knowledge about vocational school education in the counseling services in schools.
Strengthen the scheme for recruitment scholarships for individuals outside the education sector who wish to pursue vocational teacher training to work in schools.
Strengthen the internship program for vocational teachers.

Ensure that a closer connection is established between sending schools and training companies also during the apprenticeship period, so that the content of vocational training is best adapted to the needs of the labor market.
Ensure that pilot projects in vocational education based on the Steigen model are established in all counties.

Facilitate the development of an industry standard with a minimum level of teaching equipment in technical subjects in upper secondary schools. Work is being done on an industry standard for Technology and Industrial Production (TIP). Such a standard can be followed up with a coordination of the procurement and maintenance of the equipment.
Increase the equipment grant for the most expensive vocational programs in upper secondary education.
Introduce a requirement that teachers who will teach the elective subject "Work Life Studies" must have competence and personal experience with vocational processes and vocational didactics.
Promote a proposal to amend the Education Act so that all students in lower secondary school have the opportunity to choose vocational subjects.
Facilitate the offering of vocational subjects as elective courses in all secondary schools.
Facilitate further education and training for teachers who will teach the subject of working life.
Ensure good guidelines for the development of local curricula in the subject of working life.
Come back to the Parliament with proposals on how students in lower secondary school can have increased options and a larger share of practical and aesthetic subjects in their timetable.

Expand the total number of hours so that students receive one additional hour of arts and crafts per week in grades 1 to 4, in order to give students the opportunity to develop practical skills and use various tools.

Introduce a national regulation to ensure that all primary schools have a woodworking shop, music room, science lab, school kitchen, gymnasium, and suitable rooms for arts and crafts, as well as sufficient space to conduct practical and varied teaching.
Ensure enough funding for shared lessons in practical and aesthetic subjects, so that the teacher has the conditions to follow up with each individual student.

Introduce a requirement that teachers who will teach the elective subject "Work Life Studies" must have competence in and personal experience with vocational processes and vocational didactic experiences.
Come back with suggestions for changes to the subject and hour distribution that allow for more time for practical and aesthetic subjects in primary school.

Come back with suggestions that ensure all schools have satisfactory special rooms and facilities that meet the needs of the curricula for practical and aesthetic subjects, as well as a variety in the teaching of these subjects.
Facilitate more information and collaboration in School Norway, so that good local initiatives can gain greater reach.
Facilitate a more practical and varied school day, for example through more practical elective subjects and more active use of the local workforce as part of the teaching.
Promote the necessary proposals to ensure sufficient funding for mapping skills, spaces, equipment, and organization of practical and aesthetic subjects in primary education.
Introduce active learning methods as a continuing education program.
Consider formalized collaborations between secondary schools and students who are training to become vocational teachers.

Initiate a pilot project with formalized collaboration between staff in primary schools and secondary schools to strengthen the vocational approach in subjects in primary education. The project will examine whether this can help make teaching more practical and varied. The Parliament requests the government to implement arrangements for rewarding municipalities and counties that participate, and additionally to conduct a follow-up evaluation of the pilot project.
Introduce a requirement that the GLU education includes teaching in practical and aesthetic subjects. Teachers must be given the competence to utilize practical and aesthetic learning processes.
Promote a plan for how the subject of educational choices can be made more engaging and meaningful for more students.
Ensure better facilitation for combined teaching positions between primary school, culture school, and secondary school.
Introduce active learning methods as a mandatory part of the five-year primary school teacher education program.

Introduce an interest compensation scheme that will encourage municipalities and county municipalities to rehabilitate and invest in craft rooms, gymnasiums, art and craft rooms, school kitchens, music rooms, and swimming pools.

Establish a committee to investigate a new admission system for higher education in collaboration with the sector, professional organizations, students, and pupils. The goal should be to create new admission criteria that promote quality.

Investigate the advantages and disadvantages of a legal provision that gives municipalities or other public authorities the ability to halt activities and leisure pursuits aimed at children and young people, which are deemed to have a clearly integration-hindering effect.

Come back with suggestions that provide municipalities with better tools to prevent leisure activities for children and young people that may contribute to radicalization or violate children's rights or the Equality and Anti-Discrimination Act, including the possibility to map and supervise leisure activities for children and young people that involve religious education.

Present a legislative proposal that provides municipalities with a clear legal basis to intervene in order to stop activities and leisure pursuits aimed at children and young people that are deemed to have a clearly integration-hindering effect.

Come back with proposals that provide municipalities with better tools to prevent leisure activities for children and young people that may contribute to radicalization or violate children's rights or the Equality and Anti-Discrimination Act, including: a binding social contract for integration in collaboration with organizations of faith and life stance communities, and the opportunity to map and supervise leisure activities for children and young people that include religious education.
Come back with suggestions for measures to map the extent of financial support from abroad to religious organizations, regardless of whether the organization receives state funding.
Present a proposal to the Storting for the introduction of environmentally differentiated toll rates for the Environmental Package in Trondheim and E6 Trondheim–Stjørdal.

Ensure that cost-effectiveness and quality requirements carry more weight than various certification schemes in the assessment of road investment projects. It should not be a requirement that the investment projects of the Norwegian Public Roads Administration or Nye Veier be certified in accordance with CEEQUAL or similar.
Ensure more departures and lower ticket prices on the FOT routes in the upcoming tender rounds.
Ensure more departures and lower ticket prices on FOT routes, where there is no commercial basis for flight routes.
Ensure that the purchase of domestic flight routes continues as a government responsibility.

Make an assessment of how exemptions from health requirements for driver's licenses work, to ensure that drivers who are suitable for holding a driver's license receive it, and report back to the Parliament in an appropriate manner.

Promote a case to ease access to medically justified exemptions under the driver's license regulations, so that individuals with impaired vision can obtain driving rights in accordance with the practice that was in place until 2019.

Clarify how a Norwegian public-private partnership in pharmaceutical production can contribute to efforts to make Norway and Europe less dependent on medicines and active ingredients produced outside of Europe.
Promote a case that ensures public-private collaboration for the establishment of a national cluster for the development and production of vaccines for humans, animals, and fish.
Engage in dialogue with relevant production environments with the aim of entering into contingency agreements for Norwegian production of essential medicines.
Investigate and, if possible, enter into pre-purchase agreements with private actors who wish to establish Norwegian vaccine production.
Ensure that the Cervarix vaccine against HPV in the childhood vaccination program is replaced with the Gardasil 9 vaccine or other new vaccines that also protect against genital warts.

Ensure that a method assessment is conducted on the vaccine that protects against both HPV-related cancer and genital warts, and based on that, consider offering such a vaccine in the childhood vaccination program.
Map the language skills of employees in the specialist and primary healthcare services and report back to the Parliament in an appropriate manner.

Offer Norwegian language training to healthcare personnel who need it, and set requirements after the language training that a Norwegian test must be passed in order to hold a position with patient contact.

Promote proposals for necessary legislative changes to introduce a requirement for a passing Norwegian test at a minimum B1 level for patient contact in the healthcare system, and a passing Norwegian test at a B2 level for positions that require higher education.

Investigate a legal regulation of language requirements – combined with the provision of language training – that is necessary to ensure quality and patient safety in the healthcare service, and report back to the Parliament in an appropriate manner.

Establish a special investigation commission to map racism in Norway, both the historical development and the current situation, with particular attention to structural racism, and to propose new measures. The commission must consist of individuals with professional expertise in the field, including researchers, as well as members who themselves have a minority background. The commission should be given a long-term perspective and be mandated to commission new research.
Return to the Storting with a proposal to include the term "racism" in the Education Act § 9 A-3.
Strengthen information about anti-discrimination legislation, its enforcement, and where to seek assistance in individual cases, for groups that have experienced discrimination.
Establish more "guide" programs based on the models of Rosa competence and Jewish guides/pathfinders.
Establish a dedicated research center, create a long-term research program, or increase research on the topic of racism and discrimination.
Ensure increased competence on racism in teacher education.
Lower the threshold for revocation of liquor licenses due to discrimination reasons mentioned in the Penal Code § 186.

Ensure that the country's schools, after the COVID-19 pandemic, welcome youth organizations, cultural life, and sports organizations to the schools, so that schools can be secured as an important recruitment arena for voluntary youth work, and so that students have the opportunity for democratic participation and to take a stand on various directions within voluntary work.
Increase the basic funding for children's and youth organizations.

Take the initiative to collaborate with the Ministry of Culture, the Ministry of Health and Care Services, and the organizations that represent the voluntary youth organizations, to develop a plan for the role of youth organizations in the reopening of society.

Engage in dialogue with KS and the National Council for Children's and Youth Organizations in Norway with the aim of ensuring that children's and youth organizations have access to schools and other public buildings locally, and to contribute to equal treatment in lending.
Propose 80% government funding for crisis center services through earmarked funds.

Promote a proposal to amend § 2 of the crisis center law to introduce a requirement for sufficient proximity to the nearest crisis center service, so that geographical coverage aligns with the fact that crisis center services should be easily accessible, and to regulate this further in regulations.
Promote a proposal to amend § 2 of the crisis center law to introduce a requirement for round-the-clock staffing.

Promote a proposal to introduce a general regulatory framework in the crisis center law and to establish a quality standard through regulations to further regulate the implementation of the requirement for physical separation, requirements for competence, including child-related expertise, that the length of stay at the crisis centers must be adapted to the time it takes to provide support and necessary assistance for the victims of violence to re-establish themselves, and the content of the follow-up during the re-establishment phase.
Conduct an evaluation of the crisis center services for men and report back to the Parliament in an appropriate manner.
Ensure that the crisis center services for the Sami indigenous population are improved, and inform the Parliament in an appropriate manner.
Ensure that crisis centers cannot charge a co-payment for the service. There should be no exception for any expenses related to food at cost price.
Review the law on municipal crisis center services and propose that there should be no co-payment for food from individuals.

Propose amendments to the law on motorized traffic in uncultivated land and waterways so that municipalities can decide that unplowed roads can be used for recreational snowmobile driving in general, for certain areas/roads, or as part of a trail network without the requirement for an impact assessment according to national regulations. For driving to be permitted, the municipality must obtain the consent of the landowners/road board.

Change the regulations for motorized traffic in uncultivated land so that minor terrain interventions that will not be easily visible on bare ground, such as the removal of stones, trees, etc., can be permitted where necessary, in the same way as the establishment of hiking/recreational trails in uncultivated land.

Change the regulations for motorized traffic in uncultivated areas so that local trail associations can use snow groomers and ATVs equipped with tracks for the development and maintenance of recreational trails for snowmobile use without special permission.
Simplify the processes for establishing snowmobile trails by ensuring that the creation of the trails follows the provisions of the Planning and Building Act.
Amend the regulations for motorized traffic in uncultivated land so that municipalities can set time restrictions for driving permits to their own cabins.
Change the regulations for motorized traffic in uncultivated areas so that established ice fishing trails can be maintained if the municipalities wish to do so.

Amend the regulations for motorized traffic so that municipalities can decide to grant permission for the use of ATVs on dry land where commercial activities in the wilderness are of significant importance.

Promote proposals for the revision of the law on motorized traffic in uncultivated land and waterways with the aim of reducing bureaucracy related to the implementation of the law, and that the law is better coordinated with the Planning and Building Act so that municipalities gain increased authority.

Promote proposals for the revision of the law on motorized traffic in uncultivated land and waterways with the aim of increasing local self-governance and reducing bureaucracy related to the implementation of the law, while also ensuring that considerations for nature and outdoor recreation are taken into account.

Present to the Storting a strategy for the upcoming implementation work of the UN Nature Agreement in Norway before the agreement is concluded at the parties' meeting on the UN Nature Agreement in 2021. The strategy for the implementation process must be presented to the Storting no later than in connection with the government's budget presentation in October 2021.
Present a parliamentary report during 2022 with proposals for a cross-sectoral action plan on how Norway will achieve the goals of the nature agreement.
Come back to the Parliament regarding the follow-up of the global framework for biodiversity in an appropriate manner as soon as possible after the framework is in place.

Investigate and propose the introduction of a compensation scheme for those who lose income due to the tightening of sea salmon fishing, among other things to safeguard the sea Sámi culture and livelihoods.
Consider other measures to strengthen the wild salmon populations and other forms of reduction in the sea salmon fishing in Finnmark, apart from stopping the use of gillnets.

Evaluate the regulation of the sea salmon fishing after the 2021 season, especially regarding the consequences for fishing in Finnmark and the coastal Sámi livelihoods, to see if the regulations have worked as intended and if they ensure a balance between fishing in the sea and in freshwater.
Investigate measures, including actions against aquaculture, to ensure sustainable wild salmon populations along the entire coast.
Investigate measures and instruments that safeguard the coastal Sámi culture and economic activities related to coastal salmon fishing.
Return to the Parliament with an assessment of the agreement between Norway and Finland regarding fishing in the Tana River system and the consequences for sea salmon fishing in Finnmark.
Stop the approved tightening of the sea salmon fishing and continue the regulation of sea salmon fishing in 2021 under the same rules as in 2020.

Come back to the Parliament in an appropriate manner with proposals for measures to strengthen the management of wild salmon, based on sustainable harvesting of the resource and the principle of burden sharing.

To strengthen the management of wild salmon, also present proposals for controlled removal of predators in connection with salmon rivers that have small and vulnerable populations, so that measures do not solely focus on reduced fishing.
Allow hook net fishing in Finnmark until the end of the year, and consider other measures to strengthen wild salmon populations and other forms of reduction in sea salmon fishing.

Make a new assessment of the tightening measures in the sea salmon fishing and how they will specifically affect the sea salmon fishermen in Southern Norway. The Parliament further requests the government to make lenient assessments of applications for exemptions for fishermen who lose a significant part of their income without other options.
Allow hook and line fishing in Finnmark in 2021, and consider other measures to strengthen wild salmon populations.
Conduct an evaluation of the status of small and vulnerable populations of wild salmon and ensure that such an evaluation is presented to the Storting in an appropriate manner after the 2021 season.
Promote proposals to ensure a more comprehensive and effective aquaculture management based on the model of the oil and gas sector.
Promote proposals to prevent small and medium-sized players from being pushed out of the aquaculture industry due to administrative burdens.
Promote proposals to ensure a more comprehensive and effective aquaculture management.
Facilitate the establishment of a government rescue helicopter base in Tromsø.
Facilitate the operation of the rescue helicopter base in Tromsø by the 330 Squadron and the state rescue helicopter service with the AW101 SAR Queen helicopter.
To establish a presence and readiness in Tromsø, rent a civilian rescue helicopter as a temporary solution with startup as soon as possible.
Start the necessary preparations to ensure that the Armed Forces take over as the operator of the search and rescue helicopter base in Tromsø when the contract with the civilian operator expires.

Initiate a mapping of the human rights situation in Norwegian nursing homes and home care services, where residents and users themselves, as well as their relatives, are also sources. The government is requested to report to the Storting in an appropriate manner.
Come back to the Parliament with a binding escalation plan to improve staffing in elderly care in the municipalities.
Implement concrete measures to prevent abuse in nursing homes through proper staffing and training of management and staff in nursing homes.
Establish national guidelines for the investigation and handling of elder abuse cases.
Establish a reporting obligation to the supervisory authorities when there is reason to believe that the elderly are being subjected to violence and abuse.
Introduce a "right to try" in Norway for ALS patients, dementia patients, and others with serious diagnoses.

Present a plan to the Parliament with measures for better follow-up, quality, and coherence in the services for individuals diagnosed with ALS, based on the Norwegian Directorate of Health's report from 2019.
Ensure that patients with ALS have the opportunity to participate in clinical treatment studies and to receive assessment from the Expert Panel for specialist health services.
Ensure increased funding for clinical research on serious diseases affecting the central nervous system, such as ALS, MS, and dementia.
Ensure that MS patients who are not offered stem cell treatment in Norway are given the opportunity to undergo this abroad, funded by the state.
Facilitate greater participation of Norwegian MS patients in research projects on stem cell treatment both domestically and internationally, with costs covered by public funding.
Propose measures to ensure that an increased number of MS patients can participate in clinical trials of stem cell treatment in Norway, and inform the Parliament in an appropriate manner.

Prepare a proposal for authorization for manual therapists, and then conduct a consultation on such a proposal, before the Parliament receives a comprehensive case regarding authorization for new professional groups for treatment.
Propose necessary changes to the Health Personnel Act with the aim of granting authorization to naprapaths, osteopaths, speech therapists, and paramedics.

Follow up on its own consultation proposal regarding authorization for new professional groups in accordance with the Health Personnel Act once the consultation period has ended, and return to the Parliament in an appropriate manner.

Ensure that the null alternative is investigated as a real option for the development of Sykehuset Innlandet HF before a decision is made regarding the future hospital structure ("target image") in the corporate meeting.

Strengthen existing patient services and professional environments in both somatic and mental health care at Sykehuset Innlandet HF until a new hospital structure is approved and realized, in order to ensure stabilization and recruitment of healthcare personnel.

Ensure a hospital capacity in Sykehuset Innlandet that corresponds to the future needs of the population, and prevent the health enterprise from planning future hospital capacity based on an assumption of increased efficiency, cuts in inpatient treatment, and significant task transfers to the municipalities.
Ensure that the will of the Storting is followed when the Decision Forum makes its decisions for individuals who fall under the category of rare diseases.

Investigate an alternative payment model for treatments implemented in the specialist health service, where the payment is calculated based on the observed health benefits after the treatment has been utilized.

Investigate how the Decision Forum for new methods can make the best possible decisions across specialist health services and municipal health and care services, in order to ensure sound socio-economic decisions.
Ensure that the health enterprises, in their development plans for future structure and service offerings, are required to highlight and emphasize the reduction of climate impacts.
Develop a climate plan for the healthcare sector, with the goal of achieving a climate-neutral healthcare sector, and present this as a matter for the Parliament.
Develop a climate budget for the healthcare sector and report on this in the national budget. The climate budget must include emissions from operations, procurement, transportation, and construction.
Develop a climate plan for the healthcare sector with the goal of achieving a climate-neutral sector, and present it to the Parliament in an appropriate manner.

Present a strategy for how Norwegian research environments and the petroleum industry can continue their leadership in research and technology development, so that the industry remains a driving force in Norway both in terms of expertise and economically in the future.

Establish a new arrangement for DEMO 2000, where part of the funding is provided as a loan. Many projects currently receive 25% funding. For some projects with high risk and high upside, it may instead be possible to provide 50% funding, but with a 25% refund if the project is successful.
Revoke NVE's decision on the extension of the deadline for the Øyfjellet wind farm.

Present a case to the Storting on how reduced road traffic and a stronger focus on cycling, walking, and public transport can help reduce the spread of microplastics in nature due to decreased emissions from tire wear and road dust.
Prioritize that a larger share of existing aid funds is directed towards concrete measures aimed at marine littering.
Withhold aid funds from countries that have not committed to, and do not implement, effective measures against marine littering.
Specify the responsibilities of the county governor and the coordinating role in the work against marine littering.
Develop a comprehensive strategy and action plan against marine littering.
Provide professional support and guidance to the municipalities that are developing their own plastic action plans to combat marine littering.
Investigate an incentive scheme to encourage more volunteers, including teams and organizations, to contribute to plastic cleanup.
Work towards a binding global agreement against plastic pollution in the ocean.
Return to the Storting with a proposal to tighten the penalties for dumping waste from ships along the Norwegian coast.

Consider introducing a grant scheme that covers the costs associated with waste disposal following voluntary cleanup actions. The Parliament requests the government to present a case on this in connection with the state budget for 2022.

Follow up on the Parliament's decision to ensure a uniform development of infrastructure for zero and low-emission technology, and additionally facilitate a faster application process for gas distributors applying for investment support for filling stations from Enova, as well as immediately improve Enova's support scheme for filling stations and the purchase of heavier vehicles using biogas as fuel.

Simplify the application process for support for biogas vehicles, based on the model for support for heavy electric vehicles, where Enova promises a straightforward application process with quick responses.

To change the use of the term zero emissions in all government objectives and plans to zero emissions and biogas, with the intention of treating biogas equally with electricity and hydrogen, and this terminology should apply to both already adopted and future plans.
Ensure equal treatment of biogas vehicles with zero-emission vehicles on routes funded by tolls, effective from January 1, 2022.

To take the initiative to harmonize the framework conditions for biogas production in the Nordic countries and return to the Parliament with a plan for this in order to contribute to the development of the biogas industry in Norway.

Investigate and return with principles and tools for how area neutrality can be achieved, which means that no more nature should be destroyed. If it is necessary to make interventions in nature due to new developments, at least an equivalent area of nature of similar type and quality in the surrounding areas should be restored.
Intensify the work on nature mapping and strengthen the organization of the mapping efforts, so that the valuable nature in Norway can be mapped by 2030.

Promote a proposal for a building ban on wetlands. Given the unique carbon storage effect of wetlands (which also leads to increased climate emissions when developed) and their essential role as habitats for species, all unnecessary construction in these areas should be avoided. The building ban can be introduced in the Planning and Building Act, similar to the existing building ban in the coastal zone.
